Meaningful work is fueled by meaningful performance and career development conversations with your manager. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:
Guide partners on a broad range of specific Technology Controls and Information Security programs, policies, standards and incidents.
Conduct risk assessment, required controls definition, control procedure appropriateness, vulnerability assessments and any other relevant areas.
Lead or contribute to the completion of risk and control design assessments for an assigned business application, business portfolio, and overall enterprise, as well as risk mitigation and remediation plans and remediation strategy.
Contribute to the definition, development, and oversight of a global security management strategy and framework.
Ensure technology, processes, and governance are in place to monitor, detect, prevent, and react to both current and emerging technology and security threats against TDBG’s business.
Develop on-going technology risk reporting, monitoring key trends and defining metrics to regularly measure control effectiveness for own area.
Adhere to internal policies and procedures, technology control standards, and applicable regulatory guidelines.
Contribute to the review of internal processes and activities and assist in identifying potential opportunities for improvement.
Adhere to, advise, oversee, monitor and enforce enterprise frameworks and methodologies that relate to technology controls / information security activities.
Influence behavior to reduce risk and foster a strong technology risk management culture throughout the enterprise . Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your credentials, but your relevant experience and knowledge can be just as likely to get our attention. It helps if you have:
University Degree.
Information Security Certification / Accreditation an asset.
7+ years of relevant experience.
Expert knowledge of IT security and risk disciplines and practices.
Advanced knowledge of of organization, technology controls, security and risk issues.
Demonstrated ability to participate in complex, comprehensive or large projects and initiatives.
Ability to serve as a lead expert resource in technology controls and information security for project teams, the business, organization and outside vendors.

Join our team!
Are you ready to take the next big step in your hospitality career? Four Seasons Hotel Toronto is currently looking for a talented and dynamic Security Administrator who shares our passion for excellence and who infuses enthusiasm into everything they do!
The Security Administrator is an integral part of the Hotel’s Security Department. Reporting to the Director of Security, the Security Administrator provides support to the Security team through command of the Security Office Access Control and CCTV systems as well as administrative and clerical duties relating to the day-to-day Security operations.


As well as carrying out their duties in an efficient and expedient manner, the candidate is expected to adhere to the department’s strict confidentiality policies. While this position is not a Security position, the holding of a valid Security License for the Province of Ontario is considered an asset for the applicant; the successful candidate will be assisted in acquiring same. The ideal candidate is self-motivated as well as comfortable working independently and as part of a team throughout the day. Strong multitasking skills with a strong, firm, and yet hospitable interpersonal approach when dealing with guests, employees, contractors and visitors (in person, over the phone or through email) are essential for success in this role. The ideal candidate would remain mindful of being the voice and representative to Four Seasons guests and approach all interactions as such.
This role presents itself as the face of a multi faceted command center in which decisions are being made; solutions are being sought; while tasks are being undertaken with initiative and foresight. While typically a fast paced environment, there includes slower times which must be recognized, prioritized and capitalized for full realization of what is required of this position.

Essential Job Functions:
Responsible for control and upkeep of Facility Access Programs
Creation, issuance and documentation of Staff and Resident access credentials
Responsible for the day-to-day business operation of the Security Office, including but not limited to, auditing and ordering of supplies, filing of paperwork and records, initiating Purchase Orders, etc.
Tending and auditing of databases relating to access control.
Creation or streamlining of existing electronic documents relating to departmental needs.
Liaising with departments throughout the Complex to ensure best practices and policies are upheld.
Identifying and signing in Contractors/Visitors to the Complex
Recognizing malfunctions and placing service calls relating to Security systems
Receiving, logging and preparing to ship out Lost Property.
Receiving calls for Security from around the Complex and dispatching Security Agents
Clerical and Administrative Duties relating to the Security Department.

Other Duties as assigned by Director and Assistant Director of Security
Preferred qualifications and skills
Excellent command of the English (spoken and written)
Excellent Communications skills
Maintains a clean and clear working area and promotes a safe working environment.
Maintains at least an Intermediate working knowledge of Office Applications required (specifically Excel, Word and PowerPoint).
Previous experience with Facility Control and CCTV programs preferred.
Experience with Micros Opera an asset but not required.
Minimum of 2-3 years working in an Office environment.
ABOUT FOUR SEASONS HOTELS & RESORTS
Four Seasons is dedicated to perfecting the travel experience through continual innovation and the highest standards of hospitality. The deeply instilled Four Seasons culture is personified by its employees – people who share a single focus and are inspired to offer great service. At Four Seasons, we believe in recognizing a familiar face, welcoming a new one and treating every one we meet the way we would want to be treated ourselves. Whether you work with us, stay with us, live with us, discover with us, we believe our purpose is to create impressions that will stay with you for a lifetime. It comes from our belief that life is richer when we truly connect to the people and the world around us.
What to expect
Employee Travel Program that includes complimentary room nights & employee experience rates at Four Seasons Hotels & Resorts with discounted meals and other services at each location
Excellent Training and Development opportunities
Educational assistance, access to E-Cornell University online courses at discounted pricing as well as in-house training workshops for line and management employees.
Complimentary Employee Meals
A robust extended flex benefit plan, including medical, HCSA, dental, vision, life insurance, DPSP/RRSP/TFSA and paid time off.

Network Security Specialist
Permanent Full Time
Hybrid: Cambridge, Toronto & Remote
Gore Mutual is on a transformation journey and as part of our growth trajectory we are building a new and enhanced Enterprise Cyber-Security team to guide, protect and develop a robust security program that enables the business to meet their goals with the assurance and peace of mind that strong security controls are in place.
To continue our journey forward, we are looking to onboard Network Security Specialist. We are looking for an energetic person to join the Enterprise Security department to support our cybersecurity policy support for a broad range of needs, including Assessment & Authorization, system risk analyses, and cyber security best practices.
We are on a new path called NEXT HORIZON
The insurance industry is changing at an exponential pace, driven by changing customer experience, climate change and technology. In response Gore Mutual is making bold moves to reposition our company as a purpose driven, digitally led national insurer. Next Horizon is our 10-year vision and strategy that sets a new path for our company.
Come and make your mark on our Next Horizon!
What will you be doing in this role?
NETWORK SECURITY GOVERNANCE Develop, maintain, and improve existing/new security technologies, processes and governance to effect proactive security monitoring/detection capabilities. Gather and understand network security requirements, controls, policies, and threats by consulting with other internal security experts, 3rd party sources, and suppliers on current and future threats, mitigations, and services Lead the identification of opportunities and development of recommendations to eliminate risk, improve service capability, and reduce cost Create network security technology infrastructure architectures in support of business and technical initiatives Supply thought leadership regarding network security hardware and software technologies and infrastructure architecture Verify appropriate security solutions are developed and implemented for network infrastructure components Assist in the development and enforcement of hardware and software standards appropriate for the network security environments Communicate and share network subject matter and architecture blueprints to internal and external business and technology partners to encourage their understanding, involvement, and development
NETWORK SECURITY OPERATIONS Provide global operational ownership for network security infrastructure & operations (firewalls, proxies, content filtering, load balancers, VPN gateways, IPSEC, SSL/TLS, IDS/IPS), enforcing standards, policy compliance and running day-today operations. Network security design, configuration, testing and preventive measurement on infrastructure Enforces security governance by monitoring and administering security technologies (IPS/IDS, Firewalls, DDoS Protection, Web-Filtering, NAC, WAF, Load Balancers and Proxies) Provide periodic vulnerability testing, and lead remediation projects Demonstrate best practices in network documentation as required
NETWORK SECURITY AUDIT Create technically detailed reports based on findings of intrusions and events Perform assessment and analysis on anomalous network and system activity Audit network security tools for misconfigurations and other inefficiencies or redundancies Deployment and configuration / optimization of network security audit tools
What will you need to succeed in this role? 3 years of experience in Network administration 3 years of experience Network Security 3 years of experience in Cloud Security Hands-on experience with SD-WANS, VLANS, NSGs, VNETS, TCP/IP protocol stack, Azure cloud, Palo-Alto network tools, Cisco routers/switches, NG Firewalls, WAFs, PCI-DSS network segmentation, Zero Trust Network architecture Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Detail-oriented and able to work independently. Flexible and able to adapt to changing needs. Team player with a positive attitude.
NOTE: This is a hybrid role that includes the flexibility to work remotely, but also regular in-person meetings in our Cambridge facility is expected (twice a week).
Gore Mutual Insurance is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the recruiting process, including the application process. If you require accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. If you are selected for an interview and require accommodation, please advise the HR representative who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation.

Information Security Administrator

The Information Security Administrator will work as a member of the Enterprise IT Security team. They will provide dedicated support toward the implementation of a comprehensive information security program for Washington Corporations. They will protect company IT assets, and associated data, from damage, theft, or malicious attacks of any kind. This position’s area of responsibility will span administrative and technical areas of information technology. They will provide consultation to management regarding all areas of information technology for accurate controls and implementations and assist in the coordination of information technology threat research, analysis, collection, training, and reporting.

Reports to: IT Security Manager, Washington Corporations

Duties and Responsibilities:

Implement the Strategy

Works with IT Security Manager to maintain and update a comprehensive information security program which includes information security policies and methodologies.
Works with IT Security Manager to establish, plan, administer, and update the overall policies, goals, and procedures for the information security function.
Initiates, implements, and develops information security, records retention in accordance with organizational information security needs.
Evaluates information risk and potential vulnerabilities on a regular time schedule.
Continually develops processes and workflows for bringing new employees into company systems, as well as ensuring departing employees are accurately removed from systems.
Consults and collaborate with network administrators, system administrators, desktop support staff, web developers, and non-ITS departments on security issues and requirements.
Works with company data center, networking, desktop support, and engineering staff to recommend configuration and maintenance of network, systems, and information security equipment.
Improves security efficiency, streamlines work processes and works closely with IT department personnel to accomplish objectives.

Operate the Function

Responsible for the day-to day administration and maintenance of the IT Security team’s applications, devices, products, appliances, and operating systems
Facilitate and administrate the deployment, integration, and initial configuration of new security solutions and improvements to existing security solutions.
Promotes information security awareness through training and education.
Coordinates with responsible stakeholders on all company information security related activities, including password management, data management and data storage, electronic and otherwise.
Assesses risk and responds to incidents on company information systems, including data networks, telecom networks, web systems, data center systems, and other data management assets.
Participates in investigations into problematic activity.
Monitors and audits systems and data logs to identify potential threats to the company’s networks and systems.
Administers information security education programs for company stakeholders.
Documents changes to systems and networks that impact company security.
Provide on-call response to remediate critical problems with networks, systems, security alerts and notifications.
Maintain up-to-date and detailed knowledge of the IT security industry.
Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations.
Performs other duties as assigned

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Individuals must possess certain knowledge, skills and abilities or be able to explain and demonstrate that the individual can perform the essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation, using some other combination of skills and abilities.

Familiarity and knowledge of security administration standard methodologies.
Understand the issues involved with managing, administering, and maintaining institutional technology infrastructure, including network connectivity, Internet access, wireless access, email, etc.
Ability to review and evaluate the company’s networks and collaborate on recommendations for changes
Must have outstanding communication skills, both orally and in writing, using the English language.
Must have excellent customer skills.
Ability to capture information from other IT staff and non-IT staff to obtain information regarding potentially related problems to network systems.
Knowledge of monitoring and maintaining routers, switches, firewalls, and other networking devices.
Knowledge of information security principles and practices to include, but not limited to, the following areas: Vulnerability Scanning; Security Information and Event Management; Host Based Security; Malware Prevention
Knowledge of IPS/IDS, packet/traffic analysis and related tools
Ability to research and recommend purchases of tools to maintain and improve the company’s information security systems.
Ability to deliver reporting on and providing fixes to identified vulnerabilities
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to use office equipment, computers, and network diagnostic tools.
Ability to work cooperatively with and contribute to a diverse workplace through ideas or experience.

Qualification Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in an information technology related field and/or equivalent field experience.
Minimum two (2) years combined IT-related work experience in the following key areas:
Information Security
IT support
Managing networking equipment such as firewalls, routers, switches, and network or data center security appliances/devices.
Network administration.
Enterprise Windows Server and/or Linux/BSD/Unix administration
Strong Microsoft Windows system administration skills
Knowledge of Windows desktop systems.
Functional knowledge of TCP/IP routing, DNS, DHCP, TCP and UDP, firewalls, routers, and network appliances.

We recognize the value of skills and knowledge gained outside of formal higher education and paid employment. Applicants who do not meet minimum qualifications but present other qualifications or experience equivalent to those required will be considered and are encouraged to apply. To qualify under equivalency, applicants must indicate how they qualify under equivalency by responding to the supplemental question presented during the application process.

Preferred:

Experience with large scale LANs/WANs
Experience with Information Security Systems including Next-Gen Firewalls, Content Management, Vulnerability Management, SIEMs, ACLs, IDS/IPS, PAM, and/or Email Filtering Products.
Knowledge of CIS Controls and system hardening.
Knowledge of CMMC
Experience with Microsoft Windows 10, LDAP, Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, Windows Servers, VMWare, MS SQL Server, web platforms and Linux O/S.
Experience with programming or scripting.
Experience with various wireless systems and protocols and how to secure them
Familiar with network scanning software
Security Administration knowledge and education such as
Performing risk assessments
Designing and developing security policies and programs
Educating others on security risks and mitigation strategies
Basic graphic and web design skills
Thorough understanding of PC hardware / software configuration
Industry Certifications: GSEC, GISF, CompTIA Security+, CompTIA Network+, CCNA, etc.

Seaspan has a Vaccination Status Policy setting out our expectations regarding the collection of vaccination status information. Under the Policy, all employees and individual contractors working at Seaspan are required to report their vaccination status. Upon hire, new employees and contractors will be requested to provide documentation verifying their vaccination status.

We strongly encourage all our employees to be vaccinated. While we are not mandating vaccinations at this time, it is our hope that all employees will support workplace safety efforts by becoming vaccinated and sharing their vaccination status with us.

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request. Information Security Administrator

The Information Security Administrator will work as a member of the Enterprise IT Security team. They will provide dedicated support toward the implementation of a comprehensive information security program for Washington Corporations. They will protect company IT assets, and associated data, from damage, theft, or malicious attacks of any kind. This position’s area of responsibility will span administrative and technical areas of information technology. They will provide consultation to management regarding all areas of information technology for accurate controls and implementations and assist in the coordination of information technology threat research, analysis, collection, training, and reporting.

Reports to: IT Security Manager, Washington Corporations

Duties and Responsibilities:

Implement the Strategy

Works with IT Security Manager to maintain and update a comprehensive information security program which includes information security policies and methodologies.
Works with IT Security Manager to establish, plan, administer, and update the overall policies, goals, and procedures for the information security function.
Initiates, implements, and develops information security, records retention in accordance with organizational information security needs.
Evaluates information risk and potential vulnerabilities on a regular time schedule.
Continually develops processes and workflows for bringing new employees into company systems, as well as ensuring departing employees are accurately removed from systems.
Consults and collaborate with network administrators, system administrators, desktop support staff, web developers, and non-ITS departments on security issues and requirements.
Works with company data center, networking, desktop support, and engineering staff to recommend configuration and maintenance of network, systems, and information security equipment.
Improves security efficiency, streamlines work processes and works closely with IT department personnel to accomplish objectives.

Operate the Function

Responsible for the day-to day administration and maintenance of the IT Security team’s applications, devices, products, appliances, and operating systems
Facilitate and administrate the deployment, integration, and initial configuration of new security solutions and improvements to existing security solutions.
Promotes information security awareness through training and education.
Coordinates with responsible stakeholders on all company information security related activities, including password management, data management and data storage, electronic and otherwise.
Assesses risk and responds to incidents on company information systems, including data networks, telecom networks, web systems, data center systems, and other data management assets.
Participates in investigations into problematic activity.
Monitors and audits systems and data logs to identify potential threats to the company’s networks and systems.
Administers information security education programs for company stakeholders.
Documents changes to systems and networks that impact company security.
Provide on-call response to remediate critical problems with networks, systems, security alerts and notifications.
Maintain up-to-date and detailed knowledge of the IT security industry.
Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations.
Performs other duties as assigned

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Individuals must possess certain knowledge, skills and abilities or be able to explain and demonstrate that the individual can perform the essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation, using some other combination of skills and abilities.

Familiarity and knowledge of security administration standard methodologies.
Understand the issues involved with managing, administering, and maintaining institutional technology infrastructure, including network connectivity, Internet access, wireless access, email, etc.
Ability to review and evaluate the company’s networks and collaborate on recommendations for changes
Must have outstanding communication skills, both orally and in writing, using the English language.
Must have excellent customer skills.
Ability to capture information from other IT staff and non-IT staff to obtain information regarding potentially related problems to network systems.
Knowledge of monitoring and maintaining routers, switches, firewalls, and other networking devices.
Knowledge of information security principles and practices to include, but not limited to, the following areas: Vulnerability Scanning; Security Information and Event Management; Host Based Security; Malware Prevention
Knowledge of IPS/IDS, packet/traffic analysis and related tools
Ability to research and recommend purchases of tools to maintain and improve the company’s information security systems.
Ability to deliver reporting on and providing fixes to identified vulnerabilities
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to use office equipment, computers, and network diagnostic tools.
Ability to work cooperatively with and contribute to a diverse workplace through ideas or experience.

Qualification Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in an information technology related field and/or equivalent field experience.
Minimum two (2) years combined IT-related work experience in the following key areas:
Information Security
IT support
Managing networking equipment such as firewalls, routers, switches, and network or data center security appliances/devices.
Network administration.
Enterprise Windows Server and/or Linux/BSD/Unix administration
Strong Microsoft Windows system administration skills
Knowledge of Windows desktop systems.
Functional knowledge of TCP/IP routing, DNS, DHCP, TCP and UDP, firewalls, routers, and network appliances.

We recognize the value of skills and knowledge gained outside of formal higher education and paid employment. Applicants who do not meet minimum qualifications but present other qualifications or experience equivalent to those required will be considered and are encouraged to apply. To qualify under equivalency, applicants must indicate how they qualify under equivalency by responding to the supplemental question presented during the application process.

Preferred:

Experience with large scale LANs/WANs
Experience with Information Security Systems including Next-Gen Firewalls, Content Management, Vulnerability Management, SIEMs, ACLs, IDS/IPS, PAM, and/or Email Filtering Products.
Knowledge of CIS Controls and system hardening.
Knowledge of CMMC
Experience with Microsoft Windows 10, LDAP, Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, Windows Servers, VMWare, MS SQL Server, web platforms and Linux O/S.
Experience with programming or scripting.
Experience with various wireless systems and protocols and how to secure them
Familiar with network scanning software
Security Administration knowledge and education such as
Performing risk assessments
Designing and developing security policies and programs
Educating others on security risks and mitigation strategies
Basic graphic and web design skills
Thorough understanding of PC hardware / software configuration
Industry Certifications: GSEC, GISF, CompTIA Security+, CompTIA Network+, CCNA, etc.

Assesses risk and responds to incidents on company information systems, including data networks, telecom networks, web systems, data center systems, and other data management assets.
Participates in investigations into problematic activity.
Monitors and audits systems and data logs to identify potential threats to the company’s networks and systems.
Administers information security education programs for company stakeholders.
Documents changes to systems and networks that impact company security.
Provide on-call response to remediate critical problems with networks, systems, security alerts and notifications.
Maintain up-to-date and detailed knowledge of the IT security industry.
Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations.
Performs other duties as assigned

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Individuals must possess certain knowledge, skills and abilities or be able to explain and demonstrate that the individual can perform the essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation, using some other combination of skills and abilities.

Familiarity and knowledge of security administration standard methodologies.
Understand the issues involved with managing, administering, and maintaining institutional technology infrastructure, including network connectivity, Internet access, wireless access, email, etc.
Ability to review and evaluate the company’s networks and collaborate on recommendations for changes
Must have outstanding communication skills, both orally and in writing, using the English language.
Must have excellent customer skills.
Ability to capture information from other IT staff and non-IT staff to obtain information regarding potentially related problems to network systems.
Knowledge of monitoring and maintaining routers, switches, firewalls, and other networking devices.
Knowledge of information security principles and practices to include, but not limited to, the following areas: Vulnerability Scanning; Security Information and Event Management; Host Based Security; Malware Prevention
Knowledge of IPS/IDS, packet/traffic analysis and related tools
Ability to research and recommend purchases of tools to maintain and improve the company’s information security systems.
Ability to deliver reporting on and providing fixes to identified vulnerabilities
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to use office equipment, computers, and network diagnostic tools.
Ability to work cooperatively with and contribute to a diverse workplace through ideas or experience.

Qualification Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in an information technology related field and/or equivalent field experience.
Minimum two (2) years combined IT-related work experience in the following key areas:
Information Security
IT support
Managing networking equipment such as firewalls, routers, switches, and network or data center security appliances/devices.
Network administration.
Enterprise Windows Server and/or Linux/BSD/Unix administration
Strong Microsoft Windows system administration skills
Knowledge of Windows desktop systems.
Functional knowledge of TCP/IP routing, DNS, DHCP, TCP and UDP, firewalls, routers, and network appliances.

We recognize the value of skills and knowledge gained outside of formal higher education and paid employment. Applicants who do not meet minimum qualifications but present other qualifications or experience equivalent to those required will be considered and are encouraged to apply. To qualify under equivalency, applicants must indicate how they qualify under equivalency by responding to the supplemental question presented during the application process.

Preferred:

Experience with large scale LANs/WANs
Experience with Information Security Systems including Next-Gen Firewalls, Content Management, Vulnerability Management, SIEMs, ACLs, IDS/IPS, PAM, and/or Email Filtering Products.
Knowledge of CIS Controls and system hardening.
Knowledge of CMMC
Experience with Microsoft Windows 10, LDAP, Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, Windows Servers, VMWare, MS SQL Server, web platforms and Linux O/S.
Experience with programming or scripting.
Experience with various wireless systems and protocols and how to secure them
Familiar with network scanning software
Security Administration knowledge and education such as
Performing risk assessments
Designing and developing security policies and programs
Educating others on security risks and mitigation strategies
Basic graphic and web design skills
Thorough understanding of PC hardware / software configuration
Industry Certifications: GSEC, GISF, CompTIA Security+, CompTIA Network+, CCNA, etc.

Note: Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees and are not construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer.

Seaspan has a Vaccination Status Policy setting out our expectations regarding the collection of vaccination status information. Under the Policy, all employees and individual contractors working at Seaspan are required to report their vaccination status. Upon hire, new employees and contractors will be requested to provide documentation verifying their vaccination status.

We strongly encourage all our employees to be vaccinated. While we are not mandating vaccinations at this time, it is our hope that all employees will support workplace safety efforts by becoming vaccinated and sharing their vaccination status with us.

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request. Information Security Administrator

The Information Security Administrator will work as a member of the Enterprise IT Security team. They will provide dedicated support toward the implementation of a comprehensive information security program for Washington Corporations. They will protect company IT assets, and associated data, from damage, theft, or malicious attacks of any kind. This position’s area of responsibility will span administrative and technical areas of information technology. They will provide consultation to management regarding all areas of information technology for accurate controls and implementations and assist in the coordination of information technology threat research, analysis, collection, training, and reporting.

Reports to: IT Security Manager, Washington Corporations

Duties and Responsibilities:

Implement the Strategy

Works with IT Security Manager to maintain and update a comprehensive information security program which includes information security policies and methodologies.
Works with IT Security Manager to establish, plan, administer, and update the overall policies, goals, and procedures for the information security function.
Initiates, implements, and develops information security, records retention in accordance with organizational information security needs.
Evaluates information risk and potential vulnerabilities on a regular time schedule.
Continually develops processes and workflows for bringing new employees into company systems, as well as ensuring departing employees are accurately removed from systems.
Consults and collaborate with network administrators, system administrators, desktop support staff, web developers, and non-ITS departments on security issues and requirements.
Works with company data center, networking, desktop support, and engineering staff to recommend configuration and maintenance of network, systems, and information security equipment.
Improves security efficiency, streamlines work processes and works closely with IT department personnel to accomplish objectives.

Operate the Function

Responsible for the day-to day administration and maintenance of the IT Security team’s applications, devices, products, appliances, and operating systems
Facilitate and administrate the deployment, integration, and initial configuration of new security solutions and improvements to existing security solutions.
Promotes information security awareness through training and education.
Coordinates with responsible stakeholders on all company information security related activities, including password management, data management and data storage, electronic and otherwise.
Assesses risk and responds to incidents on company information systems, including data networks, telecom networks, web systems, data center systems, and other data management assets.
Participates in investigations into problematic activity.
Monitors and audits systems and data logs to identify potential threats to the company’s networks and systems.
Administers information security education programs for company stakeholders.
Documents changes to systems and networks that impact company security.
Provide on-call response to remediate critical problems with networks, systems, security alerts and notifications.
Maintain up-to-date and detailed knowledge of the IT security industry.
Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, and participating in professional organizations.
Performs other duties as assigned

You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Job Description:
The Security Automation & Orchestration Engineering team participates in the supporting activities and corresponding services within Information Security Engineering.
Required:
Basic understanding and experience of Python Programming Language is a MUST
University degree or college diploma program in Computer Science, Engineering or comparable professional education/training in a field relevant to IT Security.
Note:
Must be able to obtain Reliability Status through the Government of Canada (includes a background check with fingerprinting by the RCMP)
What will you do?
Lead Python development of automated processes for the Security Orchestration, Automation, & Response (SOAR) platform
Maintenance and Administration of the Security Orchestration, Automation, & Response (SOAR) platform
Cross train with various security teams to understand functions and gain insight into automation opportunities
Collaborate with security and technology teams in improving monitoring and alerting infrastructure processes and tools
Develop and maintain required documentation for security tools and processes to support and maintain Sun Life’s strong security posture
What do you need to succeed?
University degree or college diploma program in Computer Science, Engineering or comparable professional education/training in a field relevant to IT Security.
Skills in agile development methodologies with attention to code quality while delivering secure code
Good understanding and experience of Python
Knowledge of cyber security tools such as SIEM, IDS, EDR
Experience with UNIX/Linux, Windows and Containerization
Skills and experience in AWS service (such as EC2, Lambda, RDS, SQS etc.)
Hands on skills in SOAR products
Excellent written communication skills and presentation skills.
What’s in it for you?
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
Work-life balance by scheduling your day around your priorities and having more time to spend on the important things
An environment of continuous learning and improvement
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process, or those needing job postings in an alternative format, may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.

Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

You’ll experience them all with the TLD and CustomWorks team. As a corporate division of London Drugs, one of Canada’s fastest growing and most successful organizations, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. TLD has been a leader in IT solutions in Western Canada for over 30 years and CustomWorks has been designing, supplying and installing innovative Audio Video Systems for businesses and residences for over 20 years.

We’ve built our reputation by providing innovative solutions and professional service, focused on developing long-lasting relationships with not only our clients, but our suppliers and employees as well. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!

Our TLD Computers and CustomWorksDivision in Richmond, BC currently has opportunities for:

IT Service Analyst


This position is responsible for handling first level support service requests for all technology, including workstations, server, printers, networks and vendor specific hardware and software. Provide basic support and troubleshooting, such as password resets, break/fix instructions, license assignments, documentation preparations, printer configurations, simple software installations and windows imaging, escalation to software vendors and/or Tier 2-3 support.

This position plays a supporting role to the Tier 2-3 support and requires a high level of communication, ongoing skill development and attention to detail.

Responsibilities include:
Resolve first level service requests and alerts involving technology at client sites including workstations, server, Microsoft Office, printers, routers, firewalls, VPN, Remote Desktop Services, phones, backup solutions and vendor-specific hardware and software.
Research and escalate issues to proper resources with the TLD Technical support team.
Document all support issues, resolutions and time in the company approved ticketing systems.
Communicate with clients in a professional and timely manner as required; keeping them informed of incident progress, notifying them of impending changes as per the TLD process.
Produce and provide simple documentation for Statements of Work (SOW).
Communicate clearly within all company staff and clients on the progress of a project as required.
Participate in vendor training as required.
The successful candidate should possess the following:
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Adapts easily to change.
Strong analytical skills.
Ability to work quickly and accurately under pressure.
Ability to work with all levels of staff both internally and externally.
Ability to communicate both on a technical level and a business level. Able to work on tasks with support from Senior Systems Engineers.
Participate effectively as a team member on larger projects under supervision from a Project Manager.
Capable of thinking outside the box and solution focused.
Must have demonstrated strong technical and organizational abilities.
Has the ability to simplify and break down complex problems into practical solutions.
Experience in working on Windows based server administrative console.
Ability to effectively prioritize work.
Conscientious in meeting schedules and deadlines.
EDUCATION & KNOWLEDGE:
Completion of Computer Science Degree or Information Technology Certificates such as CompTia or MCSA. This could include certification in relevant products used by TLD such as Windows OS, Backup software, etc.
Mac OS knowledge preferred.
1+ years of personal computer experience and a strong understanding of operating systems, business applications, printing systems and network systems.
Understanding of ITIL process and procedures.
Understands areas of computing infrastructure and application deployment. These include but are not limited to:
Networking and Telecom (Troubleshooting network connection, IP address, DHCP, DNS, Ping, Tracert etc.)
Operating Systems (OS installation and deployment. Having experience with system’s image deployment and upgrade
Database Systems (Familiar with Active Directory: creating user account, password policy, password reset)
Integration Technologies (System monitoring. Checking error log files and analyzing system reports)
Storage and Server Technologies (Familiar with Backup and restore system. Troubleshooting backup job alerts and errors. Having experience with backup software such as Barracuda and Symantec Backup)
Security Concepts (Data security: Familiar with NTFS permissions, data access and user’s level of access in network)
Employees will be scheduled 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday 8:00am-4:30pm. Occasional shifting of hours to meet the clients needs maybe required.

We offer advancement opportunities through our promote-from-within policies, salaries commensurate with experience, as well as the potential to earn bonuses. We offer a comprehensive benefits program including:
Comprehensive medical, dental, prescription drug and vision coverage for you and your family (Ensuring you and your family are taken care of)
Employee Discount Program (Sharing our success)
Ongoing In-House Training & Education Courses (Lifelong learning)
Employee Family Assistance Program (Free confidential counselling)
Employee Recognition Program (Tangible rewards for great work!)
If you possess the necessary skills and expertise and would like to join an exciting team of professionals,

Apply Now!

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services. Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

We offer advancement opportunities through our promote-from-within policies, salaries commensurate with experience, as well as the potential to earn bonuses. We offer a comprehensive benefits program including:
Comprehensive medical, dental, prescription drug and vision coverage for you and your family (Ensuring you and your family are taken care of)
Employee Discount Program (Sharing our success)
Ongoing In-House Training & Education Courses (Lifelong learning)
Employee Family Assistance Program (Free confidential counselling)
Employee Recognition Program (Tangible rewards for great work!)
If you possess the necessary skills and expertise and would like to join an exciting team of professionals,

Apply Now!

We are an equal opportunity employer. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work applicable to this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. Be advised, London Drugs DOES NOT use third party recruitment services. Not just a job…a communitya partnershipa team

You’ll experience them all with the TLD and CustomWorks team. As a corporate division of London Drugs, one of Canada’s fastest growing and most successful organizations, we know what it takes to build a satisfying career. TLD has been a leader in IT solutions in Western Canada for over 30 years and CustomWorks has been designing, supplying and installing innovative Audio Video Systems for businesses and residences for over 20 years.

We’ve built our reputation by providing innovative solutions and professional service, focused on developing long-lasting relationships with not only our clients, but our suppliers and employees as well. We are seeking innovative, customer focused people to join our team!

Our TLD Computers and CustomWorksDivision in Richmond, BC currently has opportunities for:

IT Service Analyst


This position is responsible for handling first level support service requests for all technology, including workstations, server, printers, networks and vendor specific hardware and software. Provide basic support and troubleshooting, such as password resets, break/fix instructions, license assignments, documentation preparations, printer configurations, simple software installations and windows imaging, escalation to software vendors and/or Tier 2-3 support.

This position plays a supporting role to the Tier 2-3 support and requires a high level of communication, ongoing skill development and attention to detail.

Responsibilities include:
Resolve first level service requests and alerts involving technology at client sites including workstations, server, Microsoft Office, printers, routers, firewalls, VPN, Remote Desktop Services, phones, backup solutions and vendor-specific hardware and software.
Research and escalate issues to proper resources with the TLD Technical support team.
Document all support issues, resolutions and time in the company approved ticketing systems.
Communicate with clients in a professional and timely manner as required; keeping them informed of incident progress, notifying them of impending changes as per the TLD process.
Produce and provide simple documentation for Statements of Work (SOW).
Communicate clearly within all company staff and clients on the progress of a project as required.
Participate in vendor training as required.
The successful candidate should possess the following:
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Adapts easily to change.
Strong analytical skills.
Ability to work quickly and accurately under pressure.
Ability to work with all levels of staff both internally and externally.
Ability to communicate both on a technical level and a business level. Able to work on tasks with support from Senior Systems Engineers.
Participate effectively as a team member on larger projects under supervision from a Project Manager.
Capable of thinking outside the box and solution focused.
Must have demonstrated strong technical and organizational abilities.
Has the ability to simplify and break down complex problems into practical solutions.
Experience in working on Windows based server administrative console.
Ability to effectively prioritize work.
Conscientious in meeting schedules and deadlines.
EDUCATION & KNOWLEDGE:
Completion of Computer Science Degree or Information Technology Certificates such as CompTia or MCSA. This could include certification in relevant products used by TLD such as Windows OS, Backup software, etc.
Mac OS knowledge preferred.
1+ years of personal computer experience and a strong understanding of operating systems, business applications, printing systems and network systems.
Understanding of ITIL process and procedures.
Understands areas of computing infrastructure and application deployment. These include but are not limited to:
Networking and Telecom (Troubleshooting network connection, IP address, DHCP, DNS, Ping, Tracert etc.)
Operating Systems (OS installation and deployment. Having experience with system’s image deployment and upgrade
Database Systems (Familiar with Active Directory: creating user account, password policy, password reset)
Integration Technologies (System monitoring. Checking error log files and analyzing system reports)
Storage and Server Technologies (Familiar with Backup and restore system. Troubleshooting backup job alerts and errors. Having experience with backup software such as Barracuda and Symantec Backup)
Security Concepts (Data security: Familiar with NTFS permissions, data access and user’s level of access in network)
Employees will be scheduled 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday 8:00am-4:30pm. Occasional shifting of hours to meet the clients needs maybe required.

We offer advancement opportunities through our promote-from-within policies, salaries commensurate with experience, as well as the potential to earn bonuses. We offer a comprehensive benefits program including:
Comprehensive medical, dental, prescription drug and vision coverage for you and your family (Ensuring you and your family are taken care of)
Employee Discount Program (Sharing our success)
Ongoing In-House Training & Education Courses (Lifelong learning)
Employee Family Assistance Program (Free confidential counselling)

job_title: Instructor – IT Security and Network Administration
listing_jobDesc:
Pclass # C9999

Job Summary
VCC Continuing Studies is seeking instructors with industry and teaching experience to teach in the Network Technology Administration and Security, Network Security, and IT Operations programs. Successful candidates will be offered a term contract position, with opportunities for renewal of instructional assignments.

For a list of courses, please check the program webpage at https://www.vcc.ca/international/programs/programs-ie/network-technology-administration-and-security-post-degree-diploma/


This position is responsible for teaching students in an assigned field of study using a diverse set of instruction methods and tools. The position prepares teaching materials, provides assessments of students’ progress, and develops lesson plans/syllabi. It ensures the proper stewardship of college facilities, equipment and other inventories, including, but not limited to, lab infrastructure. The position is also responsible for upholding the College policies and procedures, participating in meetings, events and on committees.

Preference will be given to applicants with skills and industry expertise in one or more of the following areas:

System Administration and IT Infrastructure Management
Computer Network Design, Architecture, and Security
Vulnerability Assessment
Penetration Testing
Cybersecurity
Cloud Computing
Operating Systems
Project Management


Job Duties/Responsibilities
Utilize industry knowledge to teach and engage students using a diverse and systematic plan of lectures, presentations, demonstrations, discussion groups, laboratory work, shop sessions, seminars, case studies, and independent or group projects.
Develops curriculum, prepares teaching materials, including audio-visual and web-related materials, where appropriate.
Effectively communicate with students, in a group or individual setting, using both visual techniques and verbal communication.
Prepares, administers and marks papers, tests, exams and other assessments to monitor and evaluate students’ progress. Evaluate students’ progress and provide detailed feedback on student performance.
Arranges for and supervises independent or group projects, laboratory work or hands-on training.
Maintain effective stewardship of classroom facilities, equipment, materials, software and tools.
Adhere to VCC policies and procedures, including being available to students, and maintaining confidentiality of students and information.
Participate in departmental and college meetings and events, and consult with other college departments as needed.
Creates a positive learning environment by consistently demonstrating preparedness for class, by motivating students to accomplish educational and personal goals and by providing the opportunity to receive and act on student feedback
Performs other related duties as required.


Qualifications
Minimum Diploma, Bachelor’s degree preferred, in a related technical field
Minimum three years of current and relevant industry experience
Demonstrated exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
Teaching experience in a post-secondary education environment is preferred
Relevant industry certifications are an asset (e.g. MCITP, CCNP, CCNA, CCNA, CompTIA A+, Network+, Security+)
Experience teaching in an online environment is preferred
Ability to create an inclusive atmosphere while servicing a diverse student body
Evidence of commitment to team and personal professional growth
Provincial Instructor Diploma, an asset.


Salary Range - Prorated based on FTE
$60 – $85 per hour.

Posting Detail Information
Employment Group Continuing Studies

Type of Position Term

Employment Type Part Time

Department TECHNOLOGY

Primary Location - This position may require you to work at all VCC locations. Downtown

Is this posting only for internal applicants? No

Desired Start Date - May be subject to change 09/01/2022

Position End Date - For Temporary Positions

Vacation Blackout Dates

Number of Hours per Week Hours vary.

Work Schedule - Hours may vary according to the needs of the Department
Daytime and/or evenings based on course schedule (may include weekends).

Eligible for Fortnight No

Special Instructions to Applicant
Please note that this is a term contract position, with the possibility of future renewal.
Please address your cover letter to:
Sid Khullar
Program Coordinator

Posting Close Date 08/25/2022

A little about Capital PowerCapital Power (TSX: CPX) is dedicated to powering a sustainable future for people and planet. Headquartered in Edmonton, Alberta, we’re a growth oriented North American power producer that creates innovative electricity solutions to electrify the world reliably and affordably while protecting the planet for future generations. We’re passionate about our employees and place their entire wellbeing at the center of our people strategy. We are proud to foster a culture that values diversity, equity, and inclusion; recognizing this is paramount to help grow our company and reach our net carbon neutral by 2050 goal. We’re proud to foster an inclusive environment where employees are empowered to be their best, make meaningful contributions and go home safe every day.Your OpportunityOne Temporary Full Time (Up to 12 months) Position.Capital Power Corporation is currently seeking an innovative and results-oriented individual to join our IS Cyber Security team.Reporting to the Cyber Security Manager, the IS Associate, Cyber Security supports the operation of Capital Power’s cyber security infrastructure. This includes participating in daily operational tasks (including such items as monitoring health, incident management, change management, patching, security reviews, etc.) The IS Associate, Cyber Security is expected to have strong documentation skills, attention to detail, effective time management, ability to set priorities and meet deadlines, great interpersonal skills, adherence to industry best practices, and understand what systems are critical to Capital Power.You will contribute to our team byProviding support services for IS operations and working closely with our internal teams and managed service providers.Supporting sophisticated and diverse set of cyber security hardware, services, and processes for multiple business areas.Ensuring team provides highly adaptable and customer-focused support services for all Capital Power business units, including support for the Service Desk.Participating in appropriate security reviews for key systems and vendors.Providing support services that meets outlined “Service Level Agreements” in this highly sophisticated environment.Providing input into decisions within the cyber security team – ensuring standard methodology is followed.Participating in the investigation and resolution of cyber security events.Applying appropriate trouble-shooting skills and ensuring best-practice steps are followed in developing, testing, and implementing solutions.What you will bring to the roleEducation:Student or recent graduate in Network Engineering, Computing Science, Computer Engineering, Cyber Security program or equivalent.Preference will be given to those students who are scheduled to complete their 3rd year of education (approx. 80 credits) in a degree program; or have substantially completed their diploma.Experience:Experience with Operating Systems, TCP/IP networks and basic Cyber Security concepts.Hands-on trouble shooting of application and network issues using logs and common tools.Experience working in a corporate environment as a member of a team would be an asset but not a requirement.Technical Skills:Common networking protocols such as TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS and TLS.Knowledge of Active Directory and Windows DomainsExperience with Python or PowerShell is considered an asset.Understanding of cloud services and data governance as it relates to cyber security.Self-motivated, organized, customer focused, detail-oriented, and effective communicator.Problem solving, results driven and action-oriented when working on assigned tasks.Working Conditions:Hybrid Office/Work from home position, with possible very minimal travel to meet business users at Capital Power facilities or other offices.Additional DetailsIn order to be considered for this role you must be legally eligible to work in Canada.The successful candidate for this position will undergo an education verification, reference checks and criminal record check.Capital Power employees that refer a successful candidate for this position are eligible for a $500 Referral Reward!We offer a highly flexible benefits and wellbeing program, comprehensive onboarding and training, and various development opportunities to support your success and personal growth.How To Apply and Next StepsCapital Power only accepts resumes via online application at www.capitalpower.com/careers. If you choose to submit your resume by any other means, we cannot guarantee that your application will be considered for vacancies.Applicants with disabilities who require a reasonable accommodation to complete their application can request accessible formats, communication support, or other accessibility assistance by contactingcareers@capitalpower.com.Capital Power is committed to providing a fair and transparent hiring process. We recognize and embrace the value of diversity and hire employees with the appropriate skills, experience and knowledge for each position.Thank you for taking the time to apply and expressing interest in powering a sustainable future with Capital Power! Superior Propane is Canada’s leading and reliable propane provider. Customers have trusted the experts at Superior to fuel their homes and businesses since 1951. Customer Focus, Performance, Safety, and Winning with People are the four key values that are the foundation of everything that we do.
Superior Propane is looking for a dynamic, strategic and results-driven professional to join our team in the role of Cyber Security Analyst, reporting to Manager Information Technology Security and Governance.
The Cyber Security Analyst will play a key role in implementing, enforcing and maintaining security best practices within the enterprise. The position is located in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA), Ontario, Canada but the individual will work in a Hybrid model.
This role will report into Manager, IT Security & Governance, a newly created position in the organization. The candidate will have the opportunity to define and influence the security process, tools and posture of a multibillion dollar company with a growing US and Canadian footprint.
The position will include the following responsibilities:
Contribute to the vulnerability management program by evaluating the results of automatic scans and working with relevant asset owners on remediation
Maintain the vulnerability security digest and provide updates to relevant parties
Work with the IT outsourcing service provider to ensure the security of the IT infrastructure
Collaborate as Cyber Security subject matter expert on projects, providing guidance and requirements to address security compliance and reduce risk
Assist in defining, updating and operating Cyber Security processes
Support contract management with suppliers
Perform security assessments for internal and external IT solutions and services
Provide advice to colleagues in IT and other corporate departments on information security-related topics
Drive cybersecurity awareness and training campaigns
Evaluate the effectiveness of existing tools, methods and solutions to identify potential areas of improvement to further enhance quality of the Information Security program
Contribute to IT policy, standard, and procedures
Plan and conduct Cyber security Incident runbooks. Conduct period drills to constantly refine the process.
Support Risk and compliance control selection, implementation and enforcement.
Working with IT System Administrators, Application Specialists and Network Analysts to ensure optimal security.
Selecting, implementing and operating all security related tools, such as:
End Point Protection
Security Information Event Management
Cloud Access Security Brokers
Firewalls
Unified Threat Management
Microsoft System Centre Configuration Manager
Vulnerability Assessment Tools
Identity and Access Management
Social Engineering & Training
Network Access Control (in conjunction with the Network Analyst)
AzureAD
Multi-factor Authentication (MFA) solutions
Reporting security breaches as they occur to IT leadership.
Providing weekly-monthly-quarterly-annual reports to IT leadership.
Taking the lead in any security breaches and following the process as per policy and procedure
Working on projects as the security lead, acts as a Tier 2 IT resource on projects.
Responsible for the security portion of audit compliance, reporting to Internal Audit and External Audit as needed.
Managing the security and business continuity (backups, restores, tests) portion of all vendors (SaaS, IaaS, Managed Services) ensuring they comply with our vendor management & security policy.
Handling security and infrastructure cloud (Office 365, IaaS etc.) related escalation tickets from the Service Desk Tier 1
Working with IT leadership to identify and evaluate innovative ideas. As a member of relevant security industry-based groups, will attend appropriate conferences, webinars etc.
In conjunction with the System Administrator, administer the VMWARE infrastructure and data center environment at support services office.
Identify new and emerging cyber risks and prepare recommendations for appropriate countermeasures, including, but not limited to, new technology investments, new standards, changes in policy or reconfiguration of existing systems or business processes.
Problem solver who tackles challenges with a strong hands-on and can-do attitude
What will you need to succeed?
Qualifications:
These qualifications will make you successful in this role:
Experience in an information security focused role, or a role that had significant Cyber Security functions (3-5 years preferred experience)
Good technical background in networking and system administration
Experience using and managing a variety of tools and technologies
A degree in computer science or related discipline
Experience with Cyber Security investigations, Cyber forensics or threat hunting is a big bonus
Familiarity with public Cloud technologies, like AWS or Azure
Relevant certifications would be an asset, SSCP, CISSP, CEH or GIAC
Be able to learn quickly and adjust to changing technologies and Cyber Security threats
Be a self-starter, able to initiate activities and follow through
Have good communication skills and the ability to convey ideas and information orally and in writing
We are open to relevant non Canadian work experience.
Travel
This role will be located in the GTA, Ontario, Canada. It is estimated that approx. 10% travel within Canada and the United States will be required. Travel to the corporate office in Toronto will also be required for training, team building, meetings and special projects.

Social Engineering & Training

Reporting security breaches as they occur to IT leadership.
Providing weekly-monthly-quarterly-annual reports to IT leadership.
Taking the lead in any security breaches and following the process as per policy and procedure
Working on projects as the security lead, acts as a Tier 2 IT resource on projects.
Responsible for the security portion of audit compliance, reporting to Internal Audit and External Audit as needed.
Managing the security and business continuity (backups, restores, tests) portion of all vendors (SaaS, IaaS, Managed Services) ensuring they comply with our vendor management & security policy.
Handling security and infrastructure cloud (Office 365, IaaS etc.) related escalation tickets from the Service Desk Tier 1
Working with IT leadership to identify and evaluate innovative ideas. As a member of relevant security industry-based groups, will attend appropriate conferences, webinars etc.
In conjunction with the System Administrator, administer the VMWARE infrastructure and data center environment at support services office.
Identify new and emerging cyber risks and prepare recommendations for appropriate countermeasures, including, but not limited to, new technology investments, new standards, changes in policy or reconfiguration of existing systems or business processes.
Problem solver who tackles challenges with a strong hands-on and can-do attitude
What will you need to succeed?
Qualifications:
These qualifications will make you successful in this role:
Experience in an information security focused role, or a role that had significant Cyber Security functions (3-5 years preferred experience)
Good technical background in networking and system administration
Experience using and managing a variety of tools and technologies
A degree in computer science or related discipline
Experience with Cyber Security investigations, Cyber forensics or threat hunting is a big bonus
Familiarity with public Cloud technologies, like AWS or Azure
Relevant certifications would be an asset, SSCP, CISSP, CEH or GIAC
Be able to learn quickly and adjust to changing technologies and Cyber Security threats
Be a self-starter, able to initiate activities and follow through
Have good communication skills and the ability to convey ideas and information orally and in writing
We are open to relevant non Canadian work experience.
Travel
This role will be located in the GTA, Ontario, Canada. It is estimated that approx. 10% travel within Canada and the United States will be required. Travel to the corporate office in Toronto will also be required for training, team building, meetings and special projects.

If you have an accommodation need during the recruitment & selection process, we encourage you to connect with us at aoda_hr@superiorpropane.com to let us know how we can enhance your experience." Superior Propane is Canada’s leading and reliable propane provider. Customers have trusted the experts at Superior to fuel their homes and businesses since 1951. Customer Focus, Performance, Safety, and Winning with People are the four key values that are the foundation of everything that we do.
Superior Propane is looking for a dynamic, strategic and results-driven professional to join our team in the role of Cyber Security Analyst, reporting to Manager Information Technology Security and Governance.
The Cyber Security Analyst will play a key role in implementing, enforcing and maintaining security best practices within the enterprise. The position is located in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA), Ontario, Canada but the individual will work in a Hybrid model.
This role will report into Manager, IT Security & Governance, a newly created position in the organization. The candidate will have the opportunity to define and influence the security process, tools and posture of a multibillion dollar company with a growing US and Canadian footprint.
The position will include the following responsibilities:
Contribute to the vulnerability management program by evaluating the results of automatic scans and working with relevant asset owners on remediation
Maintain the vulnerability security digest and provide updates to relevant parties
Work with the IT outsourcing service provider to ensure the security of the IT infrastructure
Collaborate as Cyber Security subject matter expert on projects, providing guidance and requirements to address security compliance and reduce risk
Assist in defining, updating and operating Cyber Security processes
Support contract management with suppliers
Perform security assessments for internal and external IT solutions and services
Provide advice to colleagues in IT and other corporate departments on information security-related topics
Drive cybersecurity awareness and training campaigns
Evaluate the effectiveness of existing tools, methods and solutions to identify potential areas of improvement to further enhance quality of the Information Security program
Contribute to IT policy, standard, and procedures
Plan and conduct Cyber security Incident runbooks. Conduct period drills to constantly refine the process.
Support Risk and compliance control selection, implementation and enforcement.
Working with IT System Administrators, Application Specialists and Network Analysts to ensure optimal security.
Selecting, implementing and operating all security related tools, such as:
End Point Protection

Cyber Security Operations Centre (CSOC) Lead
Take a central role
The Bank of Canada has a vision to be “a leading central bank—dynamic, engaged and trusted—committed to a better Canada.” No other employer in the country offers you the unique opportunity to work at the very center of Canada’s economy, in a diverse and inclusive organization with significant impact on the economic and financial well-being of all Canadians. You will be challenged, energized and motivated to excel in an environment where we are reinventing central banking, renewing ways of doing business and reinforcing a culture of innovation.
With our defined-benefit pension plan, benefits, and high flexibility for work life balance - find out more about why we are annually ranked as one of Canada's top employers: Working Here - Bank of Canada
Cyber Security Monitoring & Response
Reporting to the Director, Cyber Security Monitoring and Response, you will join a highly impactful Cyber Security Operations Centre (CSOC) team with the mission to keep Canada’s economy safe & secure. Our team is collaborative group of about 15-20 individuals across multiple domains including Analysts, Consultants, Students, etc. As a part of the team, you will empower us to be as effective as possible by providing leadership and expertise to evolve, maintain and further integrate security monitoring, threat intelligence, threat hunting and cyber incident response.
Further - you will serve as the technical lead and be provided with the autonomy to make decisions and recommendations along with the opportunity to utilize state-of-the-art Enterprise Cyber Security Solutions and consistently learn as technology in the industry evolves.
What you will do
As a Cyber Security Operations Centre (CSOC) Lead, you will provide guidance and direction regarding day-to-day cyber operational priorities to the Cyber Security Monitoring and Response team, including supporting and leading the team through Cyber incident investigations alongside the Bank’s Cyber Security Incident Manager.
More specifically, you will:
Be the technical lead for the cyber security response team, providing guidance to incident responders and cyber leaders.
Provide guidance on tuning rules and thresholds to improve fidelity of alerts within the SIEM
Prepare reports of analysis and results to provide briefings to leadership and key stakeholders
Investigate, document, and report on information security issues and emerging trends.
Mentor and further develop team members by providing technical direction and functional support, including strategic and analytic support.
Play a lead role in the continued evolution of our monitoring, investigation and threat hunting capabilities, technologies, and processes.
Lead on reducing the SOC’s tier 1 manual effort through use of automation and other techniques/technologies
Lead development of response exercises (i.e., tabletops, purple team, etc.)
Support the hiring, development, and leading of Hybrid & Remote technical teams across Canada
What you need to succeed
You are a leader by example, capable of providing appropriate feedback to your team members and working effectively in ambiguous and/or high-pressure situations. You also have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate technical challenges and events in consumable formats both verbally and in writing.
In addition, you have:
A proven background within Cyber Security Operations including event detection and triage, investigation, incident management, and response
Strong working knowledge of security technologies within Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems (IDPS), Web Proxy, Antivirus, Security Information and Event Management (SIEMs), and/or Endpoint Detection agents
Offensive security capabilities and threat actor objectives including familiarity with any of the following: MITRE ATT&CK Framework, cyber threat intelligence, threat hunting, risk assessment and/or penetration testing.
Strong understanding of Windows OS and how to secure it including Windows logging and telemetry sources (e.g. Windows logs, Sysmon, Procmon, ETW, etc.)
Strong knowledge of network and operating system security features (e.g., Kerberos, Active Directory, Linux Auditd, etc..) including network security technologies (e.g., network firewalls, web proxies, Zeek, etc.)
Understanding of Cyber security frameworks (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK, NIST SP 800-53, etc.) and the Cyber Kill Chain
Nice-to-have:
Recent experience leading a team of Cyber Security Analysts/Engineers and working with broad range of business stakeholders to help understand and reduce cyber risk.
Familiarity with risk assessment, vulnerability assessment strategies as well as web application security.
Previous experience in vulnerability assessment programs
Relevant cyber security Industry certifications such as CISSP, OSCP, GIAC, etc.
Your education and experience
We are ideally seeking candidates with a degree in Computer Science (or a related field) along with 5+ years of relevant experience.
Any combination of education and experience that demonstrate your ability to perform the role will be considered.
What if you don’t meet every requirement?
The Bank of Canada is dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. If you are interested in this position, but your experience & skillset do not perfectly align, we highly encourage you to apply. You may be a fit for the position and/or you could be a great candidate for other roles.
What you need to know
Language requirement: English and French essential (bilingual) with a minimum starting level of functional (level 4) in second official language. Training may be provided to help reach the required level of fully functional (level 5) in second official language.
Priority will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents
Security level required: Be eligible to obtain Secret
