In response to the COVID-19 pandemic and further to public health guidelines, preventative measures are being taken to ensure health and safety during the recruitment process. All interviews are conducted virtually.
Hybrid Work Model #LI-Hybrid
The Bank is conducting a trial of a hybrid working model which provides employees with the flexibility to telework for significant portions of each month. During the trial, employees will only be required to come onsite on those days when they are involved in activities that they or their leader feel are better conducted in person. For the majority of employees, it is expected that onsite time will range from 5 to 10 days per month, depending on your role. You are expected to live in Canada, and within reasonable commuting distance of the office.
Vaccination Policy
Please note that the application of the Bank’s Covid-19 Vaccination policy has been temporarily suspended, effective June 20, 2022. As a result, you will not be required to submit verification of your vaccination status before starting employment with the Bank. However, please note that the Bank reserves the right to reintroduce vaccination requirements in the future if necessary to respond to changing public health advice and\or government direction.
We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
What you can expect from us
This is a great opportunity to join a leading organization and be part of a high-performing team. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package designed to meet your needs at every stage of your life and career. For more information on key benefits please visit A great deal to consider.
Salaries are based on qualifications and experience and typically range from $110,190 to $137,735 (job grade 19)
Depending on performance, you may be eligible for performance pay for successfully meeting (7 to 10% of your base salary) or for exceeding expectations (15% of your base salary). Exceptional performers who far exceed expectations may be eligible for higher performance pay.
Flexible and comprehensive benefits so you can choose the level of health, dental disability and life and/or accident insurance coverage that meets your needs
Extra vacation days (up to five each year) that you can purchase to add to your vacation entitlement

AWS Security Architect
THE OPPORTUNITY
TechInsights is seeking an experienced Cloud Security Architect to secure our AWS-based CI/CD operations across multiple regions in North America and Europe. Reporting to the CISO directly and working closely with the DevOps team, your focus will be on all three aspects of CIA: Confidentiality (customer information), Integrity (protection of intellectual property) and Availability (resiliency of the operational architecture through back-ups / snapshots, VPC peering, use of multiple availability zones, and Terraform). You bring sound knowledge of DevOps on AWS and how to secure such, and you possess a deep understanding of the security requirements of ISO 27001:2013 and SOC2.
OUR STORY
TechInsights is the authoritative information platform serving the semiconductor and related markets. Leveraging a unique reverse engineering competency, we reveal innovations in technology products, providing advanced technical and market analysis to organizations to help them make fact-based technology and intellectual property decisions. Over the course of thirty years, we have developed the largest technical analysis library and the proprietary reverse engineering expertise to keep pace with the latest developments in multiple technical industries and disciplines.
OUR PURPOSE
TechInsights’ purpose is to advance the world we live in by supporting semiconductor innovation and deployment of intellectual property. We do this through our intellectually astute and highly motivated people who analyze technology products from the package to the atomic level to reveal the innovations others cannot. Our detailed analyses and data are available to customers through our proprietary platforms and tools, and our technology intelligence is used to further the innovation of semiconductors, which are at the heart of all technology.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Work collaboratively to secure daily operations
Enhance the company’s IT infrastructure security protocols
Build out a robust security, identity, and compliance program on AWS
Recommend strategic improvements to the company's operations on AWS
WHAT YOU HAVE
Knowledge of the use of numerous AWS security resources is required, both individually, as well as their integration into a holistic security architecture
Knowledge of HTML, REST, JSON, and the ability to script in Python
Experience with linting, SCA, SAST, DAST, security in IAC, container hygiene, and secrets management
Experience with the successful validation of 800-53, SA-11, Developer Testing and Evaluation
Deep understanding of OWASP and OWASP API risks
Security certification from AWS or other is required. CI/CD certification from AWS or other is preferred

jeOxY5rY0I AWS Security Architect
THE OPPORTUNITY
TechInsights is seeking an experienced Cloud Security Architect to secure our AWS-based CI/CD operations across multiple regions in North America and Europe. Reporting to the CISO directly and working closely with the DevOps team, your focus will be on all three aspects of CIA: Confidentiality (customer information), Integrity (protection of intellectual property) and Availability (resiliency of the operational architecture through back-ups / snapshots, VPC peering, use of multiple availability zones, and Terraform). You bring sound knowledge of DevOps on AWS and how to secure such, and you possess a deep understanding of the security requirements of ISO 27001:2013 and SOC2.
OUR STORY
TechInsights is the authoritative information platform serving the semiconductor and related markets. Leveraging a unique reverse engineering competency, we reveal innovations in technology products, providing advanced technical and market analysis to organizations to help them make fact-based technology and intellectual property decisions. Over the course of thirty years, we have developed the largest technical analysis library and the proprietary reverse engineering expertise to keep pace with the latest developments in multiple technical industries and disciplines.
OUR PURPOSE
TechInsights’ purpose is to advance the world we live in by supporting semiconductor innovation and deployment of intellectual property. We do this through our intellectually astute and highly motivated people who analyze technology products from the package to the atomic level to reveal the innovations others cannot. Our detailed analyses and data are available to customers through our proprietary platforms and tools, and our technology intelligence is used to further the innovation of semiconductors, which are at the heart of all technology.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Work collaboratively to secure daily operations
Enhance the company’s IT infrastructure security protocols
Build out a robust security, identity, and compliance program on AWS
Recommend strategic improvements to the company's operations on AWS
WHAT YOU HAVE
Knowledge of the use of numerous AWS security resources is required, both individually, as well as their integration into a holistic security architecture
Knowledge of HTML, REST, JSON, and the ability to script in Python
Experience with linting, SCA, SAST, DAST, security in IAC, container hygiene, and secrets management
Experience with the successful validation of 800-53, SA-11, Developer Testing and Evaluation
Deep understanding of OWASP and OWASP API risks
Security certification from AWS or other is required. CI/CD certification from AWS or other is preferred
WHY WORK WITH USCompetitive pay and lucrative benefits (medical, dental, vision, RRSP Matching)Generous flexible vacation programAnnual fitness reimbursementStrong sense of camaraderie, mutual respect and shared goals amongst colleaguesCareer development opportunitiesProfessional development encouragement and well being support from managementWellness resources and support from management

Company Description
Canada Goose isn't like anything else. We’ve built something great, something special – an iconic lifestyle brand with an inspirational and authentic story. At the heart of it is our promise to inspire and enable all people to thrive in the world outside. To Live in the Open. At Canada Goose, you’re part of a movement that belongs to something bigger. One that seeks out the restorative power of nature and is driven by a purpose to keep the planet cold and the people on it warm. We endure any condition, observe every detail, and are building a community that believes in living bravely and coming together to support game-changing people.
Here, opportunities are everywhere – to try something new, to learn, to do meaningful and impactful work, and they’re yours for the taking.

Job Description
Job Purpose:
The Cybersecurity Administrator is responsible for installing, administering, and troubleshooting the organization’s security solutions; implementing network security policies, application security, access control and corporate data safeguards; providing system protection and network defense focused on ensuring data integrity and network availability; implementing and executing: computer network defense(s), device hardening, vulnerability assessments, and cybersecurity documentation; day to day administration, analysis, and response to SIEM alerts, AV/EDR events, vulnerability management, and host-based security events.
Key Responsibilities:
Ongoing configuration, maintenance of security solutions and related integrations
Analyze requirements and recommending improvements to existing security platforms such as SIEM, Identity, Next Gen AV, Cloud Security, Network Access and Firewalls
Conduct vulnerability scans and collaborate with other IT operational teams to prioritize and remediate
Identify potential threats and malicious behavior in security logs; develop methods to improve monitoring capabilities and build new SIEM alerts
Lead the deployment, integration, and configuration of all new security solutions
Lead and participate in creating, reviewing, and maintaining security-related documents such as policies, procedures, standards, baselines and response playbooks
Consult with staff, managers, and executives about the best security practices and providing technical advice
Investigate and mitigate cyber security threats and risks
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of the security industry including awareness of new or revised security solutions, improved security processes and the development of new attacks/threat vectors
Contribute to building a cyber aware culture via the development and delivery of end-user training
Assist with conducting various information security and compliance assessments
Provide security oversight during change process
Experience, Education and Designations:
Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, or other IT-related field of study
Industry certification such as SSCP, GSEC and CySA+, Blue Team Level 1or ISACA CSX required
3+ years of experience working in a Cybersecurity role
1-2+ years hands-on background in configuring, implementing, managing, and administering a wide range of IT security solutions
Experience working with and administering Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR), Single Sign On (SSO), Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) and Security Information and Event Management (SIEM)
Experience with managing security vendors and appliances Company Description

DEVSECOPS SECURITY CHAMPION (JOB NUMBER: IT-022822-JDS-001)
About BNP Paribas

BNP Paribas has a presence in 75 countries with more than 180,000 employees, including 140,000 in Europe. It ranks highly in its two core activities: Retail Banking & Services (comprised of Domestic Markets and International Financial Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking. In Europe, the Group has four domestic markets (Belgium, France, Italy and Luxembourg) and BNP Paribas Personal Finance is the leader in consumer lending. BNP Paribas is rolling out its integrated retail banking model across Mediterranean basin countries, in Turkey, in Eastern Europe and a large network in the western part of the United States. In its Corporate & Institutional Banking and International Financial Services activities, BNP Paribas also enjoys top positions in Europe, a strong presence in the Americas and solid and fast-growing businesses in Asia-Pacific.

REPORT TO

IT ARCHITECTURE Manager

MISSION AND OBJECTIVES

The CIB North American IT Team is looking for a motivated and talented Cloud/DevOps engineer responsible assisting our end-to-end journey from On-Premise to Cloud
As a team player, the Cloud/DevOps engineer will need to work closely with various stakeholders across North America, as well as, work in partnership with a variety of IT Team locally and internationally.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

Train and support ADM teams on vulnerabilities analysis, management and remediation
Steer the transformation & implementation of the security tools to shift-left on Security
Cascade up and down statuses, progression and information to stakeholders and application teams
Educate team members around cyber-security, both around code, architecture, but also code quality
Support the various application teams in their learning of security-related tools
Document and seek best practices around these tools
Document the use and typologies of vulnerabilities as well as facilitate user understanding
Propose new ways to secure code
REQUIREMENTS

TRAINING AND OCCUPATIONAL EXPERIENCE

Has deep knowledge on how to use the DevSecOps tools
3 years of experience with Security scan tools
2 / 3 years of experience with DevOps tool chain /CI / CD pipeline
Programing langages : Java or C# or TypeScript
SKILLS AND BEHAVIOURS

Understanding and remediation of vulnerabilities reported by SAST / SCA / DAST tools
Use of Security SAST / SCA / DAST security tools such as Fortify / Checkmarx / NexusIQ or OWASP plugin (Maven)
DevOps Toolchain / Configuration Management: Ansible, Jenkins, Artifactory…
Problem solving skills
Effective communication of solutions across roles & levels

A recruitment policy that promotes equity and diversity:
Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

We pride ourselves in applying non-discrimination rules to all our recruitments.

Primary Location: CA-QC-Montréal
Job Type: Standard / Permanent
Job: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY
Education Level: Bachelor Degree or equivalent (>= 3 years)
Experience Level: At least 5 years
Schedule: Full-time DEVSECOPS SECURITY CHAMPION (JOB NUMBER: IT-022822-JDS-001)

As a team player, the Cloud/DevOps engineer will need to work closely with various stakeholders across North America, as well as, work in partnership with a variety of IT Team locally and internationally.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

Train and support ADM teams on vulnerabilities analysis, management and remediation
Steer the transformation & implementation of the security tools to shift-left on Security
Cascade up and down statuses, progression and information to stakeholders and application teams
Educate team members around cyber-security, both around code, architecture, but also code quality
Support the various application teams in their learning of security-related tools
Document and seek best practices around these tools
Document the use and typologies of vulnerabilities as well as facilitate user understanding
Propose new ways to secure code 
 REPORT TO IT ARCHITECTURE Manager MISSION AND OBJECTIVES MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES  
REQUIREMENTS

TRAINING AND OCCUPATIONAL EXPERIENCE

Has deep knowledge on how to use the DevSecOps tools
3 years of experience with Security scan tools
2 / 3 years of experience with DevOps tool chain /CI / CD pipeline
Programing langages : Java or C# or TypeScript
SKILLS AND BEHAVIOURS

Understanding and remediation of vulnerabilities reported by SAST / SCA / DAST tools
Use of Security SAST / SCA / DAST security tools such as Fortify / Checkmarx / NexusIQ or OWASP plugin (Maven)
DevOps Toolchain / Configuration Management: Ansible, Jenkins, Artifactory…
Problem solving skills
Effective communication of solutions across roles & levels

A recruitment policy that promotes equity and diversity:
Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

We pride ourselves in applying non-discrimination rules to all our recruitments.

Primary Location: CA-QC-Montréal 
Job Type: Standard / Permanent 
Job: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY 
Education Level: Bachelor Degree or equivalent (>= 3 years) 
Experience Level: At least 5 years 
Schedule: Full-time Show more

Req Id: 383087
At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content - we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
Our Bell Business Markets team enables the digital transformation of businesses and governments nationwide through solutions in areas including Internet and private networks, voice and unified communications, contact centre, security, Internet of Things, data centre and cloud. We’re proud to be Canada’s leading provider of broadband network and communication services for businesses and governments.
Position Description:
This solicitation is for a Cyber Security Consultant to join the National Security Testing & Incident Response Team (STIRT). The Security Consultant will primarily be responsible to conduct Penetration Testing activities for major clients in Canada. Reporting directly to Security Testing Practice Leader, the candidate will be an ongoing participant to the portfolio evolution program along with other STIRT customer deliverables. This individual will leverage past years of experience in the IS/IT domain, his (or her) demonstrated time management skills, and proven technical knowledge to deliver and grow the team’s services nationally. The Cyber Security Consultant is accountable for the delivery of the STIRT that will be delivered across Canada.
Responsibilities:
The successful candidate will be accountable for the following:
Perform web and mobile application penetration testing, network penetration testing, wireless network security assessments and social-engineering
Be able to lead security testing project from the start to end
Develop scripts, tools and methodologies to improve STIRT processes
Develop and deliver accurate reports
 On time delivery of solutions and consulting engagements in accordance with contract terms and conditions or statements of work and industry best practices
Meeting with clients to present and disclose findings
Management of client expectations and timely resolution of issues that may arise
Ability to accurately scope and provide associated effort levels for future opportunities
Be able to communicate findings and security risk with confidence to customers’ technical staff.
Requirements:
University/College degree or equivalent business experience
2+ years experience in at least one of the following fields:
Web Application test and/or mobile testing
Software development in C#, C, C++, Python, Go, PHP or Java
Reverse Engineering skillset or exploit development
Network penetration testing
Strongly familiar with Linux/Windows based OS
Holding or in the process of obtaining at least one of the following certifications or equivalent:
OSCP
OSCE
OSWE
CRTE
GPEN
Must be eligible to work in Canada
Having participated in security competition is a plus
A strong ability to be a team player
Bilingualism is an asset (English and French); adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.
Additional Information:
Position Type: Management
Job Status: Regular - Full Time
Job Location: Canada : Ontario : Ottawa || Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Quebec : Montreal
Application Deadline: 08/21/2022
Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

Location: British Columbia - Remote

Copperleaf's enterprise software helps some of the world's largest energy firms make better strategic decisions. We have a track record of delivering award-winning, industry-changing solutions. Join our team as we continue to enable our clients to build more resilient and sustainable infrastructure.

We're looking for a Cyber Security Operations (SecOps) Analyst to join the Technology eXperience group. You will be responsible for monitoring, analyzing, and responding to cyber security events and incidents; responding to tickets initiated by the Security Operations Centre (SOC) and performing threat-hunting activities using cyber security tools; managing enterprise vulnerabilities, threat intelligence, and acting as an end-user facing representative of the SecOps team.


Key Responsibilities:
Perform initial triage on security events populated in the ticketing system by analyzing and identifying cyber threat activity based on their known techniques, tactics, and procedures
Analysis of host-based and network-based security alerts, responding to potential security incidents and vulnerabilities
Support the development of advanced Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) rules and alerts to detect adversary techniques, tactics, and procedures by providing tuning recommendations based on day-to-day monitoring
Document all activities during an incident and provide status updates during the life cycle of the incident
Foster trust and positively contribute to the Copperleaf culture by exhibiting open, honest, and collaborative qualities in all interactions


Your Background:

Intrusion detection, threat hunting, and continuous monitoring
Incident response life cycle and techniques
Networking security fundamentals
Security technology (Firewalls, IDS/IPS, EDR, etc.)
SIEM (Rapid7, Azure Sentinel)
Microsoft 365 Security toolsets
MITRE ATT&CK framework, and indicators of compromise (IoC)
Ability to quickly learn new and complex concepts
Strong analytical skills, problem solving, conceptual thinking and attention to detail
Organized, proactive, and requiring minimal management oversight
Outstanding written skills for preparing reports and briefings
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills across multiple levels of the organization

Experience:
2 years of recent operational security experience (Security Operations Center (SOC), Incident Response, Malware Analysis, Intrusion Detection System (IDS) / Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) Analysis, Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR), etc.)


Examples of Certifications:
CompTIA Security+
CISSP
CyberSec First Responder


What's it like here?

At Copperleaf, culture is at the very core of who we are and what we do. We're a world-class team of innovators that inspire one another to learn and continually push the limits of what's possible. We cultivate an atmosphere of openness and support where all opinions and ideas are valued and encouraged, and where teamwork is key to success. We value a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Founded in Vancouver, Canada, Copperleaf is committed to building a better world, one decision at a time. As one of Canada's Fastest-Growing Companies and winner of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures, we are a dynamic and disruptive organization offering exciting opportunities for growth and innovation.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are at the heart of Copperleaf's culture and play a vital role in our growth strategy. We are committed to ensuring that everyone feels a sense of belonging and can contribute to their maximum potential. Our differences are the reason great things happen here. If you are an applicant in need of accommodations or special assistance throughout the interview process, please submit a request by email to exsupport@copperleaf.com. AdaptiveMobile Security, an Enea company, is the world leader in mobile security, protecting over two billion subscribers worldwide, and the only mobile security company offering products designed to protect all services on both fixed and mobile networks through in-network and cloud solutions. Our products are deployed in 9 of the top 10 mobile operator groups worldwide.
The Threat Intelligence Unit provides services for AdaptiveMobile's clients under the categories of Messaging Abuse Prevention, Messaging Revenue Protection and Signalling Protection
Graduate Security Analyst (Canada) - This role is based in Canada and fully remote/WFH
Reports to: Head of Threat Intelligence.
The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in security and be looking for a challenging role at the forefront of the telecoms industry. You must possess a great attention to detail, be passionate about working to the highest level of accuracy and be comfortable communicating with clients at both a technical and commercial level. You will work with an experienced regional lead analyst to deliver world-class services.
This role will offer a candidate with an interest in the telecoms industry an opportunity to learn and grow in the role and contribute to the continuing evolution of AdaptiveMobile’s security products and services.
As communication is an important part of this role, candidates will be required to demonstrate presentation skills during the selection process.
Note that some shift work (Saturday or Sunday) will be required for this role.
Requirements
Essential:
BSc degree in computer science or telecoms-related field
A strong interest in telecoms and security technology
Knowledge of working in a Unix/Linux environment
Basic familiarity with SQL/Database concepts
Ability to communicate concepts clearly to technical and non-technical audiences
Desirable:
Experience with messaging systems and architectures.
Knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, SMTP and DNS
Understanding of GSM network fundamentals.
Knowledge of shell scripting or a scripting language (e.g. Python, Ruby, Perl)
Fleunt in Spanish or another second language
Responsibilities / Tasks
Create and maintain security solutions on AdaptiveMobile client platforms
Keep up to date with the telecoms threat landscape
Analyse data collected from customer deployments to identify and investigate threats
Provide security reviews for AdaptiveMobile clients; independently field client questions and manage client expectations.
Work on your own initiative, with minimal supervision, but with the support of a team lead and global team of analysts.
What we can offer you:
The opportunity to work with a Industry leading organization and the forefront of the telecommunications security industry where a great performance is quickly recognized.
Competitive Salary
Twenty days PTO, rising to Twenty Five days in line with length of service
Paid healthcare plan
Company bonus scheme
Life assurance and company pension benefit
Travel insurance for all company travel AdaptiveMobile Security, an Enea company, is the world leader in mobile security, protecting over two billion subscribers worldwide, and the only mobile security company offering products designed to protect all services on both fixed and mobile networks through in-network and cloud solutions. Tier 1 SOC Analyst Job DescriptionThe Secure Sense work environment and corporate culture is a collaborative space that embraces continual learning and self-motivated excellence while realizing that the most inspiring places to work are those that include an element of fun.Secure Sense is currently looking for a Tier 1 SOC Analyst with the ability to utilize commercial and internal tools to quickly analyze, detect, and respond to cyber security incidents. The Candidate must be able to work night shift or possibly a nights/afternoons shift rotation.Sounds great, so what’s the role exactly?Event detection? Check. Event investigation? You betcha! Escalation? Remediation? Health checks? Definitely.If you’re someone who thrives on learning new concepts and can develop methodologies quickly, we want to hear from you, today! Are you a SOC Analyst that understands the importance of responding to time-sensitive incidents, and doing so with a BFS (big fat smile)? We are looking for someone who is a team player, and excels working daily with our talented SOC team, as well as interacting with customers.Do you think you’re ready to join this group of very elite cyber security individuals? Not going to lie, we’ve got some bigwigs here, so we ask you don’t bug them for signatures.Aside from ninja skills, what other technical talents should I have?Working Knowledge of at least some of the following: firewalls, IDS/IPS, MPS, SIEM, DLPWindows OS, *NIXIndustry certification(s) in a relevant specializationExperience with malware forensicsGood understanding of network architecturePrior work experience in a SOC or NOCExperience and/or training with security vendor appliances, enterprise networking equipment--especially with any of our vendor partners (see http://securesense.ca/partners)Not technical, but I also should have: College or University degree/diploma in a relevant area of study (strong preference for specialization in security)Previous experience related to information technology (strong preference for information security)Multitasking skillsAbility to learn quickly on the job and to make informed, responsible decisionsCustomer Service experienceExceptional written and spoken communication skillsHigh level of MS Office proficiency (Word, Excel, Access)Why Secure Sense?Let your cyber security career take off with a company that cares about you, and your personal and professional needs. job_title: IT Security Specialist - Cyber, Threats, Network
listing_jobDesc: Provide IT/IM security services, and design, implement, enforce and maintain policies and procedures to protect Clients computing infrastructure (Networks, Systems, Storage) and Software (both in-house developed and vendor-supported) along with other IT assets (both on-premises and in the cloud) from all forms of security threats and risks.Responsible for investigating security-related incidents, regular access privileges reviews, and provisioning, taking appropriate steps to resolve the issues, documenting the process, and providing recommendations to block similar incidents in the future.· Solid knowledge of security appliances (e.g., firewalls, routers, etc.) and threat and risk assessment processes; knowledge of current risks and threats; and knowledge of identity access management· Advanced knowledge of network/internet security protocols and technologies such as TLS, PKI, DNSSEC, SPF, DKIM, LDAPS, SMTPS· Advanced understanding of general networking security components such as firewalls, VLANS, ACLs, NPS, VPN, network segmentation· Sound knowledge and awareness of federal and provincial regulatory requirements· Sound knowledge of the systems development life cycle and communication protocols as they relate to secure delivery of applications· Sound knowledge of and skills in using PowerShell and other scripting languages· Ability to lead security-related projects as well as identify and evaluate risks from a business and technological standpoint. Manage or improve data security in systems such as SQL, Oracle, CIFS, Backups, Disaster Recovery processes· Ability to work with multiple types of authentication technologies and MFA such as Active Directory, RADIUS, WS-Federation, SAML, JWT, certificates, smart cardsJob Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract, FreelanceContract length: 12 monthsSalary: $1.00 per monthFlexible language requirement:French not requiredSchedule:8 hour shiftExperience:IT Security Specialist: 10 years (required) Provide IT/IM security services, and design, implement, enforce and maintain policies and procedures to protect Clients computing infrastructure (Networks, Systems, Storage) and Software (both in-house developed and vendor-supported) along with other IT assets (both on-premises and in the cloud) from all forms of security threats and risks.Responsible for investigating security-related incidents, regular access privileges reviews, and provisioning, taking appropriate steps to resolve the issues, documenting the process, and providing recommendations to block similar incidents in the future.· Solid knowledge of security appliances (e.g., firewalls, routers, etc.) and threat and risk assessment processes; knowledge of current risks and threats; and knowledge of identity access management· Advanced knowledge of network/internet security protocols and technologies such as TLS, PKI, DNSSEC, SPF, DKIM, LDAPS, SMTPS· Advanced understanding of general networking security components such as firewalls, VLANS, ACLs, NPS, VPN, network segmentation· Sound knowledge and awareness of federal and provincial regulatory requirements· Sound knowledge of the systems development life cycle and communication protocols as they relate to secure delivery of applications· Sound knowledge of and skills in using PowerShell and other scripting languages· Ability to lead security-related projects as well as identify and evaluate risks from a business and technological standpoint. Manage or improve data security in systems such as SQL, Oracle, CIFS, Backups, Disaster Recovery processes· Ability to work with multiple types of authentication technologies and MFA such as Active Directory, RADIUS, WS-Federation, SAML, JWT, certificates, smart cardsJob Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract, FreelanceContract length: 12 monthsSalary: $1.00 per monthFlexible language requirement:French not requiredSchedule:8 hour shiftExperience:IT Security Specialist: 10 years (required) Show more

Do you enjoy telling the latest scary CVEs around a campfire? Threat model to identify requirements for secure product design? Finding creative ways to balance business needs and managing technical risks? Then our Director of Information Security is the perfect role for you!

Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer, you will be responsible for leading the Information Security team and keeping the business on the forefront of modern security practices. Your goal is to keep customers and the business safe from threats - through controls, audits, security practices and recommendations.

Your Day-to-Day

Lead and evolve TouchBistro's security strategy, security awareness programs, security and security incident response
Provide strategic risk guidance for IT projects, including evaluation and recommendation of technical controls
Educate IT and other leaders on security risk and mitigation strategies
Collaborate with IT and compliance team to coordinate the IT component of both internal and external audits, or other relevant partners and regulators to ensure security programs are in compliance with relevant laws, regulations, agreements and policies
Develop, maintain and publish up-to-date security policies, standards, guidelines and security awareness programs
Champion DevSecOps "shift left" approach to integrating application security at the earliest stage of the development lifecycle
Evaluate new cybersecurity threats, IT trends and effective security controls
Develop and oversee effective disaster recovery policies and standards to align with business continuity management program goals
Maintain current knowledge of industry and regulatory trends and developments for the enterprise technology
Coordinate implementation plans and procedures to ensure business critical services are recovered in the event of disasters or other incidents, and provide direction, support and in-house consulting in these areas

All About You

You have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology Systems Security or related field
You have experience leading compliance efforts through various standards and certifications (e.g. ISO 27001, NIST Cyber Security Framework, SOC2)
You are a certified Information Security Manager (CISM) or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) Certification
You have experience in establishing cybersecurity and risk metrics for reporting
You have demonstrated management skills, e.g., budget development and administration, policy development and implementation, personnel administration, staff training and development

#INDAUG
What We Offer

At TouchBistro, we are a diverse group of restaurant-obsessed, tech-loving people brought together by a mission to support the passion and success of restaurateurs. You can feel confident joining a fun, vibrant, and rapidly growing environment. You will be working alongside driven individuals who are passionate, innovative, accountable, collaborative, and respectful.

The Perks:

Company equity
Generous PTO policy
Career progression & professional development
Linkedin Learning membership
Volunteer program
Health, dental, and vision benefits
Monthly lunches
Summer employee appreciation days
Parental leave & top up
Flexible work-from-home policy
Home office setup assistance
Beautiful, brand new office spaces in the heart of downtown Toronto (our HQ), Vancouver, NYC, LA, and Chicago

About TouchBistro

TouchBistro is an all-in-one Point-of-Sale and restaurant management system that makes running a restaurant easier. We have powered more than 29,000 restaurants around the world, and we know that while passion is plenty in the restaurant industry, time and money usually aren't. Providing the most essential front of house, back of house and customer engagement solutions on one easy-to-use platform, TouchBistro helps restaurateurs streamline and simplify their operations, increase sales, drive revenue, and deliver a stellar guest experience.

TouchBistro believes in fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have an opportunity to succeed. Requests for accommodation due to a disability can be made at any stage of the recruitment process.

For applicants who are California residents, California law requires that we provide you this notice about the collection and use of your personal information. We encourage you to read it carefully. INFORMATION SECURITY ANALYSTWe’re all about the craft. KF Aerospace is proud to deliver innovative aircraft services for corporate, commercial, and military customers worldwide. Launched in 1970 out of British Columbia’s beautiful city of Kelowna, KF has grown to specialize in a wide range of aviation services including maintenance and modifications, cargo operations, military pilot training and aircraft leasing. With facilities across Canada, KF is home to a 900 strong, highly skilled workforce. Our passion for our craft fuels every project we touch.JOB OVERVIEWReporting to IT Operations Manager, Information Security Analyst is for responsible for security of KF IT Infrastructure; prevention of Cybersecurity incidents by real-time monitoring, detection, and analysis of potential intrusions; leading the design, implementation and on-going maintenance of security solutions, policies, and processes; compliance with KF IT Policies and Contractual obligations.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESWork closely with IT Operation Manager and Network Supervisor to develop security policies and standards; maintains and enforces group-wide information security policies, standards, and control techniques with the IT team.Safeguard information system assets by identifying and solving potential and actual security problems.Protect system by defining access privileges, control structures, and resources.Collaborate with network administrators to ensure that appropriate controls are implemented, operating properly, in accordance with the corporate policies.Investigate security breaches and ensuring incident management processes are documented and followed; make recommendations to IT management for security improvements.Perform regular vulnerabilities scans, penetration tests, and regular security tasks such as users, accounts, and logs reviews.Promote information security education, training, and awareness; manage KF security training solution.Produce regular security reports and briefings.Assist with new vendors and solutions security reviews.Manage 3rd party information security providers, including directing and managing deliverables.REQUIREMENTS Cyber Security Qualifications / Skills3+ years of experience in risk, compliance, and information security policy development.3+ years performing vulnerabilities scans, penetration tests and security incident management.Strong knowledge of security incident management, malware management and vulnerability management processes.Solid knowledge of network security and protocols, firewalls, routers, and switches.Solid knowledge of various information security frameworks.General RequirementsBA or BS degree or diploma in Information Security, Cyber Security, or Computer Science.CISSP, CISA, CISM, CDPSE or similar certifications.A quick learner, able to understand technical and business problems, creating and driving solutions to those problems.Available on-call after hours and on weekends for security related incidents.Ability to communicate and educate a non-technical audience about technical security issues and measures.Ability to obtain and maintain secret – level II security clearance.BENEFITSFull-Time staff benefits include (but are not limited to):Health and DentalShort & Long-Term DisabilityHealth Spending AccountPaid vacation and Personal time offThe opportunity to bank overtimePension matching plan and voluntary RRSPEmployee & Family Assistance ProgramFree financial adviceA bonus program based on organizational performanceLOCATIONThe successful incumbent could be based in the Kelowna or Hamilton areas. Occasional travel within Canada is required (for YHM location – regular quarterly visits to YLW, plus one month onsite in YLW for initial training).HOW TO APPLY Be a part of our craft. Considering the current affairs, Allstate will be conducting virtual interviews and has made arrangements for new hires to work remotely till its deemed safe to return to office.

Through our Employee Value Proposition, Opportunity, Flexibility, Community, Diversity and Family, we have worked hard to develop and nurture a culture where employees feel valued, experience personal growth, have career options and truly enjoy the work they do.

Our team is growing and we are actively looking to hire Security Analyst to join our team! Reporting to the Manager, Security Operations, you will be responsible for the day-to-day delivery of Security Operations for Allstate Canada and the operational monitoring of technology and overall delivery of Security Operations.

Role Designation: Hybrid 1-2 Days in Office

Benefits to joining Allstate

Complete Group Benefits Program customizable to your needs

Comprehensive Health and Wellness resources

Strong Brand Recognition (listed as best Employer with Kincentric since 2012).

Working within the community and giving back!

Opportunity for ongoing learning and career development.

We work a 37.5 hour work week

Accountabilities:
Monitor environment using tools such as Splunk, Qualys, McAfee Crowdstrike and ServiceNow VM and SecOps Modules

Work collaboratively within a team of security professionals and across the organization in matters of security best practices, product research and currency as well as product support

Experience with Incident Management and Incident Handling

Experience with Vulnerability Management and Penetration Testing are highly desirable

Support various IT, IT Security and Business projects by providing input on security technologies and operational practices.

Develop subject matter expertise on assigned security technologies enabling effective and efficient delivery of security services.

Qualifications:
A bachelor’s degree in Computer science, Computer Engineering or equivalent.

3+ years of broad information technology experience role for a large organization.

CISSP, OSCP, CISA is an asset but not mandatory.

Infrastructure experience with Windows, Linux, Unix,

Infrastructure experience with Windows and MAC OS.

Experience in McAfee Security Suite for endpoint. This includes ePO, Anti-Virus, Host Intrusion Prevention, Drive Encryption and Data Loss Prevention.

Experience with Splunk and the Enterprise Security Module would be an asset.

Experience with Crowdstrike and ServiceNow would be an asset.

Able to work and build excel reports using formulas and pivot tables.

Experience in IT production operations and incident response would be an asset.

Competent written and verbal communication with good presentation skills and collaborative orientation.

Allstate Canada Group has policies and practices that provide workplace accommodations. If you require accommodation please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Position Numbers: 00036504, 00039827, 00041905, & 00052768
Description:
About us:
The Faculty of Arts & Science is the heart of Canada’s leading university and one of the most comprehensive and diverse academic divisions in the world. The strength of Arts & Science derives from our combined teaching and research excellence in the humanities, sciences and social sciences across 29 departments, seven colleges and 46 interdisciplinary centres, institutes and programs.

We can only realize our mission with the dedication and excellence of engaged staff and faculty. The diversity of opportunities and perspectives within the Faculty reflect the local and global landscape and the need for curiosity, innovative thinking and collaboration. At Arts & Science, we take pride in our legacy of innovation and discovery that has changed the way we think about the world.

The Faculty’s Divisional IT team, Information and Instructional Technology (IIT) is a crucial source of support for teaching, research, and administrative operations. We are a high volume, collaborative, service focused team, supporting the day-to-day IT needs for numerous Faculty units and work with local, departmental IT teams as well as institutional IT partners to deliver and support technology initiativeswhich have included Microsoft 365 and SharePoint services, Multi Factor Authentication, Learning Management Engine and VoIP. Core functions include Infrastructure-Server/Networking & Data Centre, Client Services Teaching Technology and End User Technology Support, Product & Delivery Services and Applications & Development.

Your opportunity:
Under the direction of the Senior Manager, Client Services, the incumbent is responsible for providing exemplary service, in a collaborative, cyber-security focused and team-based environment, for the ongoing operation, maintenance, support and enhancement of all end user technologies and devices such as desktops, laptops, tablets, smartphones, audio and visual equipment, peripheral devices, VoIP phones and all operating systems, digital technology and applications associated with them, including Microsoft 365. The incumbent troubleshoots and repairs various computer hardware/software, oversees and supports the use of shared spaces, manages support tickets, prepares documentation and collaborates with IT partners to ensure items are addressed in a timely, security and service focused manner and with a proactive mindset. This is a critical role which ensure clients and supported units are effective and productive with their use of technology. There are four vacancies available.

Your responsibilities will include:
Responding to end-user service requests in a timely fashion and following up on outstanding items and technical issues via email, ticketing system, or phone
Resolving end-user issues by applying established security and other standards and working with the team on ensuring sound solutions for more complex issues and requests
Documenting detailed explanations on computing support procedures applied to resolving end-user issues
Applying established standards and serving as a technical resource when deploying software and hardware
Working proactively with the team on ensuring sound technical solutions for more complex issues and requests
With a focus on security, ensuring computer patches and anti-malware software are up to date on devices connecting to the U of T network
Suggesting minor purchases, collaborating on cost, and documenting purchases according to finance and unit policy
Ongoing learning, support and maintenance of shared spaces including labs, teaching spaces and meeting rooms
Creating editing and reviewing project, support and training documentation
Contributing to projects and initiatives as assigned
Staying current on all end user facing technologies and consistently improving technical and support skills
Essential Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or acceptable combination of equivalent education and experience.
Minimum three years of recent and related experience in a computing support role with in-depth knowledge of a wide range of computer software and hardware; extensive experience ordering, configuring, installing and troubleshooting Windows, MAC OS, PC's, laptops, printers, tablets and smartphones and recommending software where appropriate.
Minimum two years of proven process driven documentation skills and training capabilities with knowledge of technical writing principles.
Must have diverse technical application experience including, but not limited to, the standard Microsoft 365 applications (including Office, Excel, OneDrive desktop), e-mail applications, ticketing systems, MAC applications, web browsers, Adobe products, SAP, Multi-factor Authentication and cyber security training and support.
Proven and demonstrated understanding of core client hardware including Dell devices; Lenovo devices; Apple devices; Android devices; tablets.
Working knowledge of network protocols such as SMTP, IMAP, POP3, DNS, and DHCP in support of resolving issues with device endpoints
Familiarity with basic network concepts such as the client-server model, client network configuration, and the role of switches, routers, access points and firewalls.
Good understanding of domain and non-domain accounts and group policies is considered a strong asset.
Excellent knowledge and experience in supporting audio-visual and collaborative classroom and shared space technologies including, but not limited to, MS Teams, MS Stream, Zoom, Blackboard Collaborate, VoIP, projectors, digital displays, web cameras, and microphones.
Demonstrated experience in performing system health checks and mitigation to meet software and security standards including encryption, patching and backup.
Demonstrated experience in conducting root cause analysis, incident investigation, and remediation.
Demonstrated superior ticket, email, and telephone etiquette and a strong desire to help others.
Excellent problem-solving, multi-tasking, and time-management skills.
Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills with ability to communicate technical concepts to persons with limited technical backgrounds.
Ability to work effectively independently and as part of a team.
Well-informed on current technologies, best practices and industry standards.
Ability to lift up to 25 kg from ground to waist level is required.
Assets (Nonessential):
ITIL foundations level (or higher) certification.
Cyber security training or certification.
Familiarity with IT Service Management tools and processes (Service Now), endpoint management tools (Quest Kace, SCCM), and remote support tools (Bomgar).
Familiarity and basic knowledge of technologies such as MS Intune, MS Azure, Enterprise Active Directory, Identity Access Management systems and Endpoint Protection services.
Experience with Learning Management Engine (e.g., Canvas), and other similar teaching systems.
To be successful in this role you will be:
Approachable
Diplomatic
Efficient
Multi-tasker
Proactive
Resourceful
Team player
Closing Date: 08/19/2022, 11:59PM ET
Employee Group: USW
Appointment Type: Budget - Continuing
Schedule: Full-Time
Pay Scale Group & Hiring Zone:
USW Pay Band 09 - $60,006 with an annual step progression to a maximum of $76,739. Pay scale and job class assignment is subject to determination pursuant to the Job Evaluation/Pay Equity Maintenance Protocol.
Job Category: Information Technology (IT)
Note: There are four vacancies available for this role.

Position Summary
The Security Analyst will focus on security intelligence, anomaly hunting and incident response. The analyst must leverage intuition, security knowledge and a broad array of tools and advanced security techniques to uncover malicious activity, document, remediate and report them to senior management.

The successful candidate will work closely with the IT security manager to ensure that Kingspan’s digital and physical assets are protected from unauthorized access. This includes securing both online and on-premises infrastructures, analyzing the metrics and data to filter out suspicious activity, and finding and mitigating risks before breaches occur.
Key Accountabilities
Monitoring for events and incident alerts from multiple technologies to detect potentially malicious activity, assist in the remediation, and document the “lessons learned.”
Participate in incident response and be the subject matter expert on exploits or where a vulnerability is suspected of having been exploited
Verify the security of third-party vendors and collaborate with them to meet security requirements
Assistance in conducting security training, campaigns, and compliance requirements
Qualifications
Minimum 2 years of IT experience in the field of cyber security
Minimum College degree or equivalent work experience
Nice to have Certifications: CEH, CSA, CISSSP, GSEC, GCIH, GCIA or other industry-relevant security certifications
Knowledge of standard network protocols like TCP, ARP, ICMP, DHCP, DNS, HTTP, SNMP etc., and accompanying protocol/packet analysis/manipulation tools
Being familiar with information security management frameworks such as the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), Center for Internet Security (CIS), International Standards Organization (ISO) 27001 and other leading-edge frameworks.
Exceptional analytical and critical thinking, willingness to challenge the status quo. Excellent interpersonal skills.
Willing and able to travel to different locations as needed
Spoken French or Spanish an asset
Benefits
Interested in this role?

CDW's Risk Advisory Services practice specializes in Cyber Security and Risk, penetration testing, IT audit, IT operational, and technology risk advisory services. It is rooted in innovation and every decision made is to provide the best quality services for our clients. Our Cyber Security team has the advantage of being comprised of both young and developing members, as well as very seasoned professionals. Team members come from a variety of backgrounds and expertise including extensive networking, SOC, programming and IT administration, which makes for great place to work, learn, and experiment. Our mission is to provide our clients with meaningful security insights to mitigate risks associated with critical information.
Responsibilities
Key Areas of Responsibility:
Independently conduct and assist with penetration testing assessments (networks, web applications, web services, wireless networks, social engineering, etc.), red team and adversarial simulation assessments.
Document findings and create penetration testing reports; deliver the information in verbal and written format.
Provide trusted advisor consulting services to clients.
Assist clients by providing remediation action plans of the discovered vulnerabilities to improve their security posture, reducing risk to the organization and improving security resiliency.
Maintain technical proficiency, sharing knowledge throughout the firm through tool development and methodology enhancements.
Identify and implement improvements in existing processes and procedures.
Research and develop new leading-edge tools and penetration testing products and services.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of security threats, countermeasures, TTPs, security tools and network technologies.
Mentor Analysts.
Assist with the sales process.

Qualifications

Minimum Education and/or Experience
2-3 years of industry experience in penetration testing.
OSCP/OSCE/OSWP/OSWE or equivalent offensive security certifications.
University Degree or College Diploma in Computer Sciences, Information Security or a related field or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Other Required Qualifications
Strong knowledge of computer networking and/or software and web development experience.
Technical knowledge around security industry best practices and procedures.
Experience in researching exploits, techniques and developing tools to support penetration testing and red team activities.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Exceptional customer service and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision, manage several projects concurrently, meet deadlines and manage stakeholder expectations.
Eligibility to work in Canada.

Preferred Qualifications (Not Mandatory)
Bilingual English and French.
Information Security professional designations such as CISSP, CISM, CISA.
Knowledge and experience testing SCADA/OT environments.
Knowledge and experience testing cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Knowledge and experience performing source code reviews.
Ability to obtain and maintain a Government of Canada Level 2 - Secret security clearance.

Who we are:
CDW is a leading technology solutions provider to business, government, education, and healthcare organizations in Canada, the United States, and the United Kingdom. Our fingerprints can be found on technology in workplaces of more than 250,000 companies; from fresh-faced startups to international conglomerates. With the breadth of products and services we offer, there is no request too big or too small.

What you can expect from us:

Culture, coworkers, careers. CDW is not only the People Who Get IT, but the People who get People. Our relationships are fueled by our deep expertise and grounded in the CDW Way. Our empowering leadership makes things happen and inspires their teams to do the same. From the teammates beside us to the leaders who guide us, we move forward together. At CDW, you'll work with people who inspire you. People with positive, success-driven attitudes who you will learn from and forge strong relationships with. Bring your best true self-and your best ideas-to CDW. Because diverse perspectives bring forth better problem solving-and better solutions for our customers on a rapidly evolving technology landscape.
The well-being of our employees is essential to us. CDW offers a comprehensive benefits package, which includes health, dental and vision coverage, coworker stock purchase program, paid vacation time and sick days, RRSP/DPSP and DPSP match, tuition reimbursement, coworker discounts and other generous perks. Helcim is searching for a Cybersecurity Analyst to be responsible for maintaining and improving upon our internal security posture. If you are passionate about information security, penetration testing, and enjoy using burp suite, then this is the ideal role for you!
As a member of the security team, you will be working on numerous ongoing and new projects that collaborate with Developer and Non-Developer stakeholders. This role will provide a unique opportunity to grow your cybersecurity skills. Helcim is a fast-paced, high-demand company and team members must work well under pressure. The ideal candidate will embody our values and culture, and be a steward of The Way of the Helcim (see link below to our culture book).
Responsibilities and Duties

Work with our white hat partners and our vulnerability reporting program
Lead cybersecurity training sessions
Develop and implement solutions that will improve our overall system security
Penetration testing our infrastructure and web applications
Perform regular vulnerability scanning
Assist with compliance requirements

Things you could be working on:

Penetration testing our infrastructure and web apps during a cloud migration
Evaluating GCP Security Command Center and similar products to protect our cloud infrastructure
Setting up a SCA system to improve development security
Establishing secure VPN tunnels between google cloud and on prem data centers
Qualifications and Skills

Education might include a Bachelor's, technical degree, bootcamp or other certification in computer programming, software engineering, computer science.
Have or are working towards one or more relevant certifications (CEH, OSCP, GPEN, Pentest+, etc.)
Experience with Burp Suite or similar tools
Understanding of basic networking protocols such as; IP, TCP/UDP, HTTP(S), etc
Experience with Nessus or Nmap is an asset
Strong problem-solving and trouble-shooting skills


Why Helcim?

Helcim is a payments company that gives small and medium sized businesses a better way to accept debit and credit cards. Thousands of merchants across Canada and the US choose Helcim for their payment needs because of our excellent customer service and innovative software solutions. We won the Canada’s Most Admired Award for Corporate Culture in 2021, ranked number 91 on the Globe and Mail’s 2019 list of Canada’s Top 400 Growing Companies, and we have big plans to redefine the payments industry. To accomplish this, we need a talented team of people who are passionate about working in fintech. Learn more about working at Helcim in our culture book The Way of the Helcim.
At Helcim we build teams of engaged, caring and intelligent people. In return we provide an environment where you’ll be excited to come to work each day and tackle challenges with your colleagues. You’ll also enjoy company provided snacks and team lunches to keep yourself fueled and the opportunity to recharge and connect with your team members at company social events.
We invest a lot of time and energy imagining and creating a company and culture that encourages discussion, the trade of ideas, and the execution of amazing products and services. We’re friendly and collaborative, working together to achieve big goals. If you want to join our team and feel you can contribute to the growth and success of our company - we want to hear from you!
Join Our Team

If you would like to be considered for this position, please submit your Resume and Cover Letter through the "Apply for this Job" button at the link below.
Candidates must also be eligible to work in Canada. Helcim uses a hybrid work structure where team members can work 3 days in the Calgary office and 2 days at home. SOTI is committed to providing its employees with endless possibilities; learning new things, working with the latest technologies and making a difference in the world.
At SOTI, we are committed to delivering best in class mobile and IoT device management solutions. We are looking for out of the box thinkers that appreciate the art of creating great software. To us, being visionary is more important than doing things the way they’ve always been done.
We’re looking for a highly skilled Security Analyst to become a key member of the compliance team. Within this role, you will work with stakeholders and diverse teams in order to maintain a robust security stance and program.
Responsibilities
Monitoring of security events/incidents with subsequent classification and investigation follow up
Identify, document, escalate and manage security events/incidents with strict adherence to published policy
Report and manage information security risk across both infrastructure and application environments
Facilitate global security monitoring, incident response, and vulnerability assessment programs
Acts as part of the Security Incident Response Team to delegate for Information Security incidents globally
Participates in the delivery of the Information Security Program, including Security Vulnerability Management, Incident Response, Threat Management and Monitoring, Risk Reporting and Security program initiatives
Researching vulnerabilities/threats and writing technical and non-technical reports for management
Qualifications
University degree or college diploma in Computer Science, engineering, IT security management, risk management, or comparable professional education/training in a field relevant to IT Security management
Minimum 2 years in IT/Information Security, preferably with experience in vulnerability management or core security technologies
Detail oriented with strong organizational and analytical skills
Detailed Internet, networking, and computer knowledge (Software & Hardware)
Knowledge of multiple operating systems and applicable system administration skills (Windows, IOS, Linux)
Familiarity with the tools and techniques used by ethical hackers including vulnerability scanners and network mapping tools an asset
Basic knowledge of client-server applications, multi-tier web applications, relational databases, firewalls, VPNs, and enterprise Anti-Virus products
Knowledge of Information Security principles, protocols, practices and industry standards
Understanding of existing and emerging Information Security technologies
Strong in all areas of communication, able to interface with management and senior staff
Good technology generalist, with a good understanding of all aspects of IT especially architecture
Excellent written communication skills and presentation skills
Strong skills in report writing
If you want to bring your ideas to life, apply at SOTI today.
We are committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the requirements under the Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process, please notify People & Culture at careers@soti.net.
Please note that SOTI does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Services Agreement with agency/recruiter, SOTI will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. SOTI is committed to providing its employees with endless possibilities; learning new things, working with the latest technologies and making a difference in the world.
At SOTI, we are committed to delivering best in class mobile and IoT device management solutions. We are looking for out of the box thinkers that appreciate the art of creating great software. To us, being visionary is more important than doing things the way they’ve always been done.
We’re looking for a highly skilled Security Analyst to become a key member of the compliance team. Within this role, you will work with stakeholders and diverse teams in order to maintain a robust security stance and program.
Responsibilities
Monitoring of security events/incidents with subsequent classification and investigation follow up
Identify, document, escalate and manage security events/incidents with strict adherence to published policy
Report and manage information security risk across both infrastructure and application environments
Facilitate global security monitoring, incident response, and vulnerability assessment programs
Acts as part of the Security Incident Response Team to delegate for Information Security incidents globally
Participates in the delivery of the Information Security Program, including Security Vulnerability Management, Incident Response, Threat Management and Monitoring, Risk Reporting and Security program initiatives
Researching vulnerabilities/threats and writing technical and non-technical reports for management
Qualifications
University degree or college diploma in Computer Science, engineering, IT security management, risk management, or comparable professional education/training in a field relevant to IT Security management
Minimum 2 years in IT/Information Security, preferably with experience in vulnerability management or core security technologies
Detail oriented with strong organizational and analytical skills
Detailed Internet, networking, and computer knowledge (Software & Hardware)
Knowledge of multiple operating systems and applicable system administration skills (Windows, IOS, Linux)
Familiarity with the tools and techniques used by ethical hackers including vulnerability scanners and network mapping tools an asset
Basic knowledge of client-server applications, multi-tier web applications, relational databases, firewalls, VPNs, and enterprise Anti-Virus products
Knowledge of Information Security principles, protocols, practices and industry standards
Understanding of existing and emerging Information Security technologies
Strong in all areas of communication, able to interface with management and senior staff
Good technology generalist, with a good understanding of all aspects of IT especially architecture
Excellent written communication skills and presentation skills
Strong skills in report writing

job_title: New Grad - Cyber Security Research Scientist/Engineer
listing_jobDesc:
INTRO
Canadian Nuclear Laboratories (CNL) is Canada’s premier nuclear science and technology organization. CNL has been a world leader in developing peaceful and innovative applications from nuclear technology through its expertise in physics, metallurgy, chemistry, biology and engineering. CNL’s 3500 highly skilled employees deliver a range of nuclear services – from research and development, design and engineering to specialized technology, waste management and decommissioning.

CNL’s cyber security research team conducts leading edge research in cyber security of instrumentation and control systems in the nuclear industry and critical infrastructure. Digital security concerns and evolving standards and regulations are driving demand for safe and secure solutions by both business and industrial consumers. Unlike IT systems, industrial control systems are often bound by strict regulatory requirements and rigorous change controls that introduce complexities, risks and costs that are substantially higher for any modernization or modification and therefore requires specialists in I&C systems with cyber security expertise.

CNL is looking for a Cyber Security Research Scientist/Engineer who has a keen interest in cyber security and demonstrated aptitude for computer technology, software development and/or instrumentation and control application development.


DUTIES

Serve as a member of the cyber security research group, performing activities that range from conducting literature surveys to using technology to assess the suitability of various cyber security tools in industrial control system applications. Research areas may address cyber asset identification and classification, vulnerability assessments, intrusion detection, penetration testing, countermeasures development and assessment, automated auditing, data analytics, and forensic analysis.
Support the installation, configuration and maintenance of a cyber test facility. Duties may include, for example, the installation and configuration of virtual servers, next generation firewalls, intrusion detection appliances, and process control simulation equipment.
Perform software development activities such as extending open-source software to add new features and functionality in support of cyber security projects
Prepare research reports in clear and compelling writing
Collaborate with other researchers and stakeholders.
Promote a strong security culture

QUALIFICATIONS

Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Applied Mathematics from a university of recognized standing.
Introductory knowledge and/or experience with one or more cyber security technologies (e.g., intrusion detection systems, forensic analysis tools, next generation firewalls, application control, whitelisting, AV, encryption, automated auditing, analytics)
Software development experience with at least one programming/scripting language (e.g., C, C++, C#, Java, Python, Perl).
General knowledge and/or experience in aspects of the software development lifecycle and associated tools (e.g., requirements, design, implementation, integration, test, deployment, revision control, configuration management, change control).
Experience in the following technologies is highly desirable:
Modern computing technologies (e.g., VMWare and Hyper-V HyperVisors, switch and firewall configurations, Web Servers)
Operating systems (e.g., Windows, Windows Server, Linux)
Communication protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, HTTP, SSL)
I&C systems (e.g., PLCs, DCS)
Industrial I&C communication protocols (MODBUS, Profibus, OPC)
Initiative and ability to work effectively with others in a team environment, and have the ability to independently identify and solve technical problems.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.

External Closing Date: August 31, 2022 @ 11:59PM Show more

Primary Locations: Montreal, Quebec
Attendance: Hybrid
Employee Status: Regular
Schedule: Full-time
National Bank is currently undergoing the most significant technological transformation in its history and has many career opportunities to offer. As an Information Security Officer (ISO), you will provide support to the Business Information Security Officer (BISO), who represents the Information Systems Security Officer (CISO) in the Bank’s business lines. Accordingly, the ISO helps their business sector become familiar with the main cybersecurity risks and threats, understand their business impact, and make informed decisions on investing in mitigation or accepting these risks.
You will develop a relationship built on trust with your business sector in order to quickly position yourself as a preferred contributor to ensure that the sector’s business objectives are met. Your daily tasks will include aligning cybersecurity risk management with business priorities and IT delivery needs in order to anticipate obstacles and help reach the Bank’s business objectives.
This position is key to the sector’s transformation, including new work practices (agility), various initiatives of all scales, and encouraging support.
Your role:
Support the assessment and understanding of the security risk posture of all projects/initiatives assigned to your business line
Raise awareness and explain security messages to the IT delivery tower and the business line
Work closely with the business sectors to understand their vision, strategic plan and challenges
Coordinate/manage a team of Cybersecurity advisors in a matrix structure
Protect data assets by identifying and prioritizing information security risks in your business sector and providing the appropriate security requirements to mitigate risks
Help the business line and delivery tower to prioritize security activities for security essentials and track their progress to ensure that the security objectives for the year are met
Represent the business sector in cybersecurity issues with the delivery tower and the CISO team
Inspire a positive work environment and be a champion and innovator of teamwork and support
Be a trusted cyber partner to reach the business sector’s objectives
Provide tactical and strategic direction and guidance to achieve acceptable security postures
Competencies required:
Completed Bachelor’s degree in a related field and five years of relevant experience
Experience in information security
Motivated to learn new things
Able to influence stakeholders
Excellent communication skills and able to convey information in simple terms, both in writing and verbally
Bilingualism, spoken and written (English and French)
Preferred competencies
Experience in personnel management or as a team lead
Your benefits
Upon hiring, you will be eligible for a wide range of benefits. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer attractive benefits for you and your family:
Health and wellness program, including many benefits
Flexible group insurance
Pension plan
Employee Share Ownership Plan
Employee and family assistance program
Preferred banking services
Volunteer program
Telemedicine
Virtual sleep clinic
These are just a few of the many benefits we offer. We've rolled out a number of additional measures to ensure your health, safety and wellbeing during the pandemic.
We're putting people first
We're a bank on a human scale that stands out for its courage, entrepreneurial culture, and passion for people. Our mission is to have a positive impact on peoples' lives.
Our core values of partnership, agility, and empowerment inspire us, and inclusivity is central to our commitments. We offer a barrier-free workplace that is accessible to all employees.
We want our recruitment process to be fully accessible. If you require accommodations, feel free to let us know during your first conversations with us.
We welcome all candidates! What can you bring to our team?
Ready to live your ambitions?
