Open Door Group is a non-profit organization that has been serving communities across British Columbia since 1976. Today, we continue to provide tailored employment services to individuals and businesses to build strong workforce ecosystems and thriving communities.Certified as a Great Place to Work™, and ranked as one of the Top 50 Mid-Size Employers in Canada in 2021, we pride ourselves on modeling a culture of authenticity and transparency. Our core values are based on the genuine belief that all individuals have the ability to succeed and are the drivers of their own success, and we aim to support lifelong learning and career success for the people we serve, as well as our employees.As a Certified Living Wage Employer, Open Door Group strives to offer competitive wages and benefits for our staff. All permanent staff at Open Door Group receive a comprehensive, 100% employer-paid benefits package, a municipal pension plan, and supplemental benefits including earned days off and ongoing professional development. Open Door Group also offers an Employee and Family Assistance program to support the well-being of each of our staff.SUMMARY:As Open Door Group continues to grow, we are actively looking for a well-rounded, IT analyst to work as Help Desk Technician to join our Information Technology department. The candidate will report directly to our Associate Director of IT. We are looking for someone who is a natural problem-solver, professional, considerate, and consistently exercise urgency when dealing with and resolving technical issues.The IT Analyst will be responsible for the installation, implementation, operation, maintenance, and support of all user’s computers-based information systems and local area network in the branch offices. They will also be required to provide guidance and support in the use of business applications. The IT Analysts will be required to work on-site, with the opportunity to work from home as operations permit.DUTIES:Manage the Help Desk function in the IT and Security department’s as first line of support and directly represents the IT and Security department’s brand to the end users.Remotely and locally respond to and resolve requests for support through our ticket system.Interpret request for support and communicate back to the end user, through the ticket system the action plan to resolve the issue.Develop a series of steps and actions to troubleshoot and resolve the issue.Upon successful resolution of the issue the steps taken will be documented for the reference and for use in the resolution of future issues.Configure new hardware and troubleshoot workstation/laptop hardware issues.Adding to, and maintaining, the internal and end user IT knowledge bases.Assist with setup and deployment of company workstations/laptops and hardware and update asset register.Contribute to and be a part of a collaborative team environment within the IT department and the local office.Accessible after hours for emergency issues.Develop keen interest in cybersecurity, infrastructure administration, application administration and be able to develop related skills to support level 1 tickets.Any other duties as deemed necessary for the betterment of the IT department.QUALIFICATIONS:Minimum of College level Diploma in Computer Information Systems, Networking, Infrastructure and Computing Technology or equivalent1-3 years previous IT Help Desk experience.A+ & Network + Certifications or the ability to obtain within the first year of employment.SKILLS AND ABILITIES:Technical skill set should include an entry level understanding of the following Windows server environments: Windows desktop operating systems, SharePoint and user permissions, Microsoft Office products, Workstation, and laptop hardware, VOIP, Basic IP networking and connectivity.Ability to work independently without day-to-day direct supervisionProven exceptional customer service skills and high sense of urgencySuperior problem solving and troubleshooting skills are essentialStrong willingness, capacity, and desire to learn IT administration and cyber security.Excellent Interpersonal and communication skillsValid driver’s license or ability to obtain one Calling all Cyber Security professionals! Mentoring at Lighthouse Labs is a great, casual work opportunity where you will be part of shaping the next generation of Cyber Security professionals. We hear all the time that teaching others is the best way to learn, and we are proud of our quirky network of tech professionals. If you are looking for a casual work opportunity and love teaching others, we want to hear from you!
Since 2013, Lighthouse Labs has been helping curious and creative people break into the tech industry with our accelerated, personalized, and outcomes-obsessed education. Our mission is to train the next generation of tech talent in coding, cyber security, and data science by looking at the unique needs of each student and helping them map out and achieve their career goals. A major part of this approach is our robust mentorship program, where students are guided through their learning journey by professionals who work in the industry themselves.
To keep serving the ever-expanding needs of our students and communities, we’re growing our team of amazing mentors that are so key to student success. We’re looking for intermediate to senior level full-stack developers, cyber security professionals, and data scientists to join our team. Are you passionate about mentoring, are creative and critical, and excited about problem-solving? We’d love to hear from you!
Mentoring with Lighthouse Labs:
As a mentor, your mission is to support our students through their academic journey, and prepare them for their transition into an exciting new career in tech. You’ll work directly with students to coach them through any roadblocks they might be experiencing, give them tips on solving problems, and generally provide them with support and advice.
We’re flexible in how we work with mentors, and your schedule is structured according to how many hours you’re available for. Mentors are paid an hourly rate, and are able to work from any time zone. The hourly rate for mentors range from $40.00 - $55.00, depending on experience.
Click here to learn more about mentoring with Lighthouse Labs: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TXSsmB11sCJVBadK-YO21sXxstANnvzf/view
What we need from you:
The following qualifications are all important assets for aspiring mentors:
Minimum 2 years of professional experience in Cyber Security.

Experience in a range of popular technologies in Cyber Security.

Terminal Knowledge (Linux v. Microsoft) is a necessity
Knowledge in at least one of the following is a necessity: Python, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, C

A strong understanding of open source development workflows using tools such as Github

Any experience in teaching, mentoring, or tutoring is an asset.

Experience with front-end web development is an asset.
Lighthouse Labs is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All positions at this time are remote, and we welcome all applicants. Must-have skills
Windows And Linux Servers
1 Year(s)
Python
1 Year(s)
Javascript
1 Year(s)
Nice-to-have skills
Php
1 Year(s)
Sql
1 Year(s)
Language required
English

To keep serving the ever-expanding needs of our students and communities, we’re growing our team of amazing mentors that are so key to student success. We’re looking for intermediate to senior level full-stack developers, cyber security professionals, and data scientists to join our team. Are you passionate about mentoring, are creative and critical, and excited about problem-solving? We’d love to hear from you!
Mentoring with Lighthouse Labs:
As a mentor, your mission is to support our students through their academic journey, and prepare them for their transition into an exciting new career in tech. You’ll work directly with students to coach them through any roadblocks they might be experiencing, give them tips on solving problems, and generally provide them with support and advice.
We’re flexible in how we work with mentors, and your schedule is structured according to how many hours you’re available for. Mentors are paid an hourly rate, and are able to work from any time zone. The hourly rate for mentors range from $40.00 - $55.00, depending on experience.
Click here to learn more about mentoring with Lighthouse Labs: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TXSsmB11sCJVBadK-YO21sXxstANnvzf/view
What we need from you:
The following qualifications are all important assets for aspiring mentors:
Minimum 2 years of professional experience in Cyber Security.

Experience in a range of popular technologies in Cyber Security.

Terminal Knowledge (Linux v. Microsoft) is a necessity
Knowledge in at least one of the following is a necessity: Python, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, C

A strong understanding of open source development workflows using tools such as Github

Any experience in teaching, mentoring, or tutoring is an asset.

Experience with front-end web development is an asset.
Lighthouse Labs is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All positions at this time are remote, and we welcome all applicants. Must-have skills

DEVSECOPS SECURITY CHAMPION (JOB NUMBER: IT-022822-JDS-001)
About BNP Paribas

BNP Paribas has a presence in 75 countries with more than 180,000 employees, including 140,000 in Europe. It ranks highly in its two core activities: Retail Banking & Services (comprised of Domestic Markets and International Financial Services) and Corporate & Institutional Banking. In Europe, the Group has four domestic markets (Belgium, France, Italy and Luxembourg) and BNP Paribas Personal Finance is the leader in consumer lending. BNP Paribas is rolling out its integrated retail banking model across Mediterranean basin countries, in Turkey, in Eastern Europe and a large network in the western part of the United States. In its Corporate & Institutional Banking and International Financial Services activities, BNP Paribas also enjoys top positions in Europe, a strong presence in the Americas and solid and fast-growing businesses in Asia-Pacific.

REPORT TO

IT ARCHITECTURE Manager

MISSION AND OBJECTIVES

The CIB North American IT Team is looking for a motivated and talented Cloud/DevOps engineer responsible assisting our end-to-end journey from On-Premise to Cloud
As a team player, the Cloud/DevOps engineer will need to work closely with various stakeholders across North America, as well as, work in partnership with a variety of IT Team locally and internationally.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES

Train and support ADM teams on vulnerabilities analysis, management and remediation
Steer the transformation & implementation of the security tools to shift-left on Security
Cascade up and down statuses, progression and information to stakeholders and application teams
Educate team members around cyber-security, both around code, architecture, but also code quality
Support the various application teams in their learning of security-related tools
Document and seek best practices around these tools
Document the use and typologies of vulnerabilities as well as facilitate user understanding
Propose new ways to secure code
REQUIREMENTS

TRAINING AND OCCUPATIONAL EXPERIENCE

Has deep knowledge on how to use the DevSecOps tools
3 years of experience with Security scan tools
2 / 3 years of experience with DevOps tool chain /CI / CD pipeline
Programing langages : Java or C# or TypeScript
SKILLS AND BEHAVIOURS

Understanding and remediation of vulnerabilities reported by SAST / SCA / DAST tools
Use of Security SAST / SCA / DAST security tools such as Fortify / Checkmarx / NexusIQ or OWASP plugin (Maven)
DevOps Toolchain / Configuration Management: Ansible, Jenkins, Artifactory…
Problem solving skills
Effective communication of solutions across roles & levels

A recruitment policy that promotes equity and diversity:
Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

We pride ourselves in applying non-discrimination rules to all our recruitments.

Job: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY
Education Level: Bachelor Degree or equivalent (>= 3 years)
Experience Level: At least 5 years

Auto req ID: 273680BR
The Automation Security Engineer is responsible for executing the cyber security program for PepsiCo Beverages North America. This extraordinary role will engage with resources across PepsiCo IT, Manufacturing site points of contact (POC’s), Division Leaders, Engineering, and various 3rd parties to deliver cybersecurity capabilities across manufacturing facilities.
Facilitate monthly and quarter reviews to OT Sector Lead and Site Leadership teams
Act as a change manager/coordinator with all system integrators and 3rd parties
Participate in all cybersecurity review and design meetings
Serve as first level approver for all changes
Act as escalation point for concerns and issues related to cybersecurity
Identify and assist with cybersecurity training
Facilitate the scheduling of Microsoft Patching and compute asset re-boots
Work with facilities to manage compute asset inventories
Confirm compute asset and application compatibility to AV and MS Patching
Develop and manage applications for PepsiCo’s Digitized Value Chain (DVC) initiative
Skills Needed to excel in this role:
Strong verbal and written skills
Strong organizational and interpersonal skills
Strong collaborative skills and ability to work with a diverse team of resources
Knowledge of operational technology, including Industrial hardware (PLC’s, VFD’s), Industrial software (Rockwell, Wonderware, Zarpac), Industrial Networking (CPwE), Thin client Architecture and Virtualization Technology (VMWare)
Proficient installing and configuring various software applications (Rockwell software, Thingworx, DVC applications)
Strong SharePoint and Office 365 skills to develop and maintain project trackers and web hosted applications
Proficient in application developement
Compensation and Benefits:

Expected salary range is $81,000 - $120,000Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavementOther benefits, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan
Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering
3+ years’ experience
Ability to manage complex projects
Ability to travel 25%
Covid-19 vaccination may be a condition of employment dependent on role and location. For specific information, please discuss role requirements with the recruiter
Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation

Our client, Bell Canada, is looking for a Senior Security Architect for a long-term contract. If you possess both cutting-edge offensive and defensive skills, then we want to talk to you. The ideal candidate would have 8+ years working experience in a sSDLC (Secure Software Development Lifecycle) environment.Key Responsibilities and Job Duties: · Analyze vulnerabilities found through security scans and propose remediation strategies.· Continuously improve our offensive and defensive capabilities.· Create, organize, document, and run red teaming exercises.· Drive lessons learned and follow up on activities after red teaming exercises.· Support our teams in evaluating new security solutions.· Document and present relevant findings to management and peers.· Document all security incidents and assess their actual or potential damage.· Participate in brainstorming sessions with the team to create application threat models and provide guidance on effective countermeasures.· Collaborate with application developers to identify security-sensitive functionality in apps and services lacking security coverage and bring security awareness and techniques for mitigation into the affected areas.· Help maintain and scale intrusion detection and incident response pipelines and tools.· Impact security standards at all levels of the program.Key Competencies and Experience: · Certified in one of the following CompTIA Security+, CompTIA PenTest+, CISSP, CEH, CISM, CISA, CTIA, CCSP, CRISC, is considered a strong asset.· Excellent knowledge of IT security standards, risks, threats, prevention measures, and best practices.· Advanced experience in application development and sSDLC practices.· Experience with Application Security and Vulnerability Management programs that leverage SAST, DAST, network vulnerability scanners, etc.· Blended “purple team” experience: coverage of both “red team” / penetration test processes & tools as well as “blue team” defensive techniques and countermeasures.· Extensive experience with red teaming operations and/or penetration testing. Security testing tools including OWASP Zed Attack Proxy, Burp Suite, Postman.· Experience with web and API attack and mitigation methods, security assessments and penetration testing.· Knowledge of open security standards such as OWASP Top 10, CWE, OWASP ASVS, SANS Top 25, NIST.· Solid understanding of common web application technologies, languages, and frameworks.· In-depth knowledge of common software vulnerabilities.· Programming experience in .NET, C#, and Java.· Experience with Web Services such as JSON, XML and REST Technologies.· Honest and professional, strong team influencer, able to proactively support team culture that fosters knowledge sharing, excellence, and collaboration.· Able to work under pressure, facilitate discussion, decision-making, and conflict resolution.· Excellent communicator, Fluent in English, able to engage and effectively respond to third party vendors and business units.Moerae Solutions Incorporated values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. MSi welcomes and encourages people with disabilities and is committed to ensuring equal access and participation for people with disabilities. We are committed to treating people with disabilities in a way that maintains dignity and independence. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment/selection process as a result of disability.Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractSchedule:8 hour shift Our client, Bell Canada, is looking for a Senior Security Architect for a long-term contract. If you possess both cutting-edge offensive and defensive skills, then we want to talk to you. The ideal candidate would have 8+ years working experience in a sSDLC (Secure Software Development Lifecycle) environment.Key Responsibilities and Job Duties: · Analyze vulnerabilities found through security scans and propose remediation strategies.· Continuously improve our offensive and defensive capabilities.· Create, organize, document, and run red teaming exercises.· Drive lessons learned and follow up on activities after red teaming exercises.· Support our teams in evaluating new security solutions.· Document and present relevant findings to management and peers.· Document all security incidents and assess their actual or potential damage.· Participate in brainstorming sessions with the team to create application threat models and provide guidance on effective countermeasures.· Collaborate with application developers to identify security-sensitive functionality in apps and services lacking security coverage and bring security awareness and techniques for mitigation into the affected areas.· Help maintain and scale intrusion detection and incident response pipelines and tools.· Impact security standards at all levels of the program.Key Competencies and Experience: · Certified in one of the following CompTIA Security+, CompTIA PenTest+, CISSP, CEH, CISM, CISA, CTIA, CCSP, CRISC, is considered a strong asset.· Excellent knowledge of IT security standards, risks, threats, prevention measures, and best practices.· Advanced experience in application development and sSDLC practices.· Experience with Application Security and Vulnerability Management programs that leverage SAST, DAST, network vulnerability scanners, etc.· Blended “purple team” experience: coverage of both “red team” / penetration test processes & tools as well as “blue team” defensive techniques and countermeasures.· Extensive experience with red teaming operations and/or penetration testing. Security testing tools including OWASP Zed Attack Proxy, Burp Suite, Postman.· Experience with web and API attack and mitigation methods, security assessments and penetration testing.· Knowledge of open security standards such as OWASP Top 10, CWE, OWASP ASVS, SANS Top 25, NIST.· Solid understanding of common web application technologies, languages, and frameworks.· In-depth knowledge of common software vulnerabilities.· Programming experience in .NET, C#, and Java.· Experience with Web Services such as JSON, XML and REST Technologies.· Honest and professional, strong team influencer, able to proactively support team culture that fosters knowledge sharing, excellence, and collaboration.· Able to work under pressure, facilitate discussion, decision-making, and conflict resolution.· Excellent communicator, Fluent in English, able to engage and effectively respond to third party vendors and business units.Moerae Solutions Incorporated values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. MSi welcomes and encourages people with disabilities and is committed to ensuring equal access and participation for people with disabilities. We are committed to treating people with disabilities in a way that maintains dignity and independence. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment/selection process as a result of disability.Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractSchedule:8 hour shift Show more

Bill Gosling Outsourcing is committed to the career development of our people. If you are interested in joining a company with modern facilities and a team environment, click on the “Apply” button to get started!
The Information Security Analyst plans and carries out security measures to protect our organization’s computer networks and systems. Their responsibilities are continually expanding as the number of cyberattacks increases. They will be heavily involved with creating our disaster recovery plan, including preventive measures such as regularly copying and transferring data to an offsite location. It also involves plans to restore proper IT functioning after a disaster. The Information Security Analyst will continually test the steps in their recovery plans. Information Security Analysts are required stay up to date on IT security and on the latest method attackers are using to infiltrate computer systems. Analysts need to research new security technology to decide what will most effectively protect their organization. In addition to reviewing and auditing the Information Technology Infrastructure for the maintenance of security and compliance. Other responsibilities include;
Hands on installation, support, configuration and maintenance of Bill Gosling’s network and security equipment (hardware and software).
Create and assist with the maintenance of Business Management System and Business Continuity Management Manual including: Request for Change, Incident, Problem and Risk Identification process per Bill Gosling’s ISO 9001/27001 processes related to networking and security infrastructure. Ensure information is accurate and complete and provide clarification as requested. Execute changes upon approval.
Manage the securitization of LAN, WAN, routers/switches, internal/external connectivity, Firewalls, VPN, VOIP, wireless and related network/security technologies as required.
Creation and maintenance of internal and external information security documentation such as client/vendor/internal audits.
Participation in Disaster Recovery / Business Continuity / Cyber Response planning and testing.
Contribute to operational and support best practices and standard process development through secure practices.
Ensure network and security infrastructure and related procedures support business requirements.
Collaborate with, support, and provide coverage for other roles within the IT department as needed.
Perform other duties as assigned by management and/or supervisor.
Deal with clients in a professional and appropriate manner, in accordance with Bill Gosling Outsourcing’s “Promise of Performance” and “The Gosling Theory” and all Company Policies
On-call and after-hours work required
Ability to travel to/from branch offices if required
Highly available and reliable in times of emergency changes and/or support
Contact person for Network / Information Security related matters
Participation in weekly Change Advisory Board (CAB), Control Self-Assessment (CSA) Board and Information Security and Risk meetings
Logging of RFCs, Incidents, Problems and Risks per Bill Gosling’s ISO 27001 and PCI DSS standard processes.
Function as an internal consulting resource on network, information security issues and/or coordinate information security efforts with the internal Control Self-Assessment (CSA) team or other business functions
Conduct/complete information security risk assessment programs including internal, vendor and client assessments
Provide, coordinate and/or assist with network and information security awareness, Incident response and change management, Business continuity & disaster recovery programs and serve as the information security contact for all internal/external users/clients/vendors/contractors
Ensure the secure operation of the organization’s computer systems, servers, and network connections.
Audit network and user activity in addition to assisting with the maintenance of the Branch Test/Task Schedule.
Perform internal/external vulnerability scanning, reporting and remediation
Determine network and security needs, develop, and implement solutions.
Identification of non-conforming processes, security or services
Report access privileges inappropriate to job duties to the MC and/or VP for correction
Internal consulting related to understanding of ISO 9001/27001(Security) standard
Understanding of PCIDSS and requirements related to certification at Bill Gosling Outsourcing
Champion company core values and other company programs
Other duties as assigned
Education
High School Diploma
Post-secondary studies in Information Security field would be preferred
Experience
Minimum two years of work experience in IT and/or Information Security
Knowledge of computer networks, information systems, infrastructure and applications
Ability to troubleshoot, configured and deploy information systems from a security perspective considered an asset
Certificates, Licenses, & Registration:
CISSP Certified, or be able to pass the CISSP Official Exam within time allotted, or country specific equivalent
Cisco CCNA certified in R&S and/or in Security, or be able to pass the Exam(s) within time allotted, or country specific equivalent

Ability to troubleshoot, configured and deploy information systems from a security perspective considered an asset
Certificates, Licenses, & Registration:
CISSP Certified, or be able to pass the CISSP Official Exam within time allotted, or country specific equivalent
Cisco CCNA certified in R&S and/or in Security, or be able to pass the Exam(s) within time allotted, or country specific equivalent
Reports to: Head of Risk Bill Gosling Outsourcing is committed to the career development of our people. If you are interested in joining a company with modern facilities and a team environment, click on the “Apply” button to get started!  
The Information Security Analyst plans and carries out security measures to protect our organization’s computer networks and systems. Their responsibilities are continually expanding as the number of cyberattacks increases. They will be heavily involved with creating our disaster recovery plan, including preventive measures such as regularly copying and transferring data to an offsite location. It also involves plans to restore proper IT functioning after a disaster. The Information Security Analyst will continually test the steps in their recovery plans. Information Security Analysts are required stay up to date on IT security and on the latest method attackers are using to infiltrate computer systems. Analysts need to research new security technology to decide what will most effectively protect their organization. In addition to reviewing and auditing the Information Technology Infrastructure for the maintenance of security and compliance. Other responsibilities include; 
Hands on installation, support, configuration and maintenance of Bill Gosling’s network and security equipment (hardware and software). 
Create and assist with the maintenance of Business Management System and Business Continuity Management Manual including: Request for Change, Incident, Problem and Risk Identification process per Bill Gosling’s ISO 9001/27001 processes related to networking and security infrastructure. Ensure information is accurate and complete and provide clarification as requested. Execute changes upon approval. 
Manage the securitization of LAN, WAN, routers/switches, internal/external connectivity, Firewalls, VPN, VOIP, wireless and related network/security technologies as required. 
Creation and maintenance of internal and external information security documentation such as client/vendor/internal audits. 
Participation in Disaster Recovery / Business Continuity / Cyber Response planning and testing. 
Contribute to operational and support best practices and standard process development through secure practices. 
Ensure network and security infrastructure and related procedures support business requirements. 
Collaborate with, support, and provide coverage for other roles within the IT department as needed. 
Perform other duties as assigned by management and/or supervisor. 
Deal with clients in a professional and appropriate manner, in accordance with Bill Gosling Outsourcing’s “Promise of Performance” and “The Gosling Theory” and all Company Policies 
On-call and after-hours work required 
Ability to travel to/from branch offices if required 
Highly available and reliable in times of emergency changes and/or support 
Contact person for Network / Information Security related matters 
Participation in weekly Change Advisory Board (CAB), Control Self-Assessment (CSA) Board and Information Security and Risk meetings 
Logging of RFCs, Incidents, Problems and Risks per Bill Gosling’s ISO 27001 and PCI DSS standard processes. 
Function as an internal consulting resource on network, information security issues and/or coordinate information security efforts with the internal Control Self-Assessment (CSA) team or other business functions 
Conduct/complete information security risk assessment programs including internal, vendor and client assessments 
Provide, coordinate and/or assist with network and information security awareness, Incident response and change management, Business continuity & disaster recovery programs and serve as the information security contact for all internal/external users/clients/vendors/contractors 
Ensure the secure operation of the organization’s computer systems, servers, and network connections. 
Audit network and user activity in addition to assisting with the maintenance of the Branch Test/Task Schedule. 
Perform internal/external vulnerability scanning, reporting and remediation 
Determine network and security needs, develop, and implement solutions. 
Identification of non-conforming processes, security or services 
Report access privileges inappropriate to job duties to the MC and/or VP for correction 
Internal consulting related to understanding of ISO 9001/27001(Security) standard 
Understanding of PCIDSS and requirements related to certification at Bill Gosling Outsourcing 
Champion company core values and other company programs 
Other duties as assigned

High School Diploma
Post-secondary studies in Information Security field would be preferred
Experience

Knowledge of computer networks, information systems, infrastructure and applications
Ability to troubleshoot, configured and deploy information systems from a security perspective considered an asset

Overview:
Visier is the leader in people analytics. We are passionate about a 'people first' approach to business strategy and our addictive technology is transforming the way that organisations make decisions. Recently closing a hugely successful funding round and a landmark $1b valuation, Visier is embarking on an incredible phase of its 12 year growth journey.
Visier is looking for an experienced, self-motivated Security Engineer with an excellent understanding of industry best practices and hands-on experience in penetration testing and red teaming. The position is based in Vancouver, Canada and is part of Visier’s Information Security team. You will work closely with team members and other Visier teams to protect our critical assets and anticipate threats from potential adversaries. You will need to bring your experience of network and web application penetration testing, security architecture, threat modelling, and analysis. You must be able to act as a trusted resource within Visier and provide insights on security best practices, techniques & technologies. You will be an advisor, architect, and implementer of solutions and their usage in an application development environment. You must be able to define new best practices to counter emerging threats, highly-skilled threat actors, and inform good decision-making for the organization in facing the shared challenge of defending Visier and our customers. You will be passionate about keeping current with the ever-changing security landscape, technologies, and effective at sharing your knowledge with others. You should have a keen desire to practice their stealthy, ethical hacking skills on Visier applications.
What You'll be Doing...:
Discover flaws in systems and applications, guide remediation, and inform improvements to prevent recurring flaws
Participate in architecture and design review, and play a key role in hands-on implementation of security solutions for systems and applications
Inform good decision-making using a variety of techniques including red teaming methodologies, threat modeling, and acting as an advisor for industry best practices in secure software development lifecycles, application, and network security
Perform application and infrastructure vulnerability and penetration tests using external & in-house tools as well as manual and scenario based security testing
Recognize and safely utilize attacker tools & tactics and research & evaluate new attacks and threats
Develop and execute security focused test plans to identify software problems and their causes
Design, implement and maintain test automation frameworks, tools and scripts for backend, UI or mobile apps security based testing
Review security-related events, assessing severity, criticality and priority
Security log management and monitoring
Intrusion detection and prevention systems operations
Perform security reviews and threat analysis of application source code, designs, architecture and deployments (to identify security flaws and help eliminate security vulnerabilities)
Embrace a philosophy of continuous learning, keeping current with industry best practices, tools and strategies; documenting knowledge and educating fellow Visierites on security and secure coding practices
Health & Safety at Visier
Visier is committed to creating a safe and healthy environment for our employees, customers and community. As part of this commitment, we require all employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or qualify for an exemption.
The impact you'll have...:
Minimum 2+ years experience in a related role, with a degree in Computer Science (relevant post-secondary degrees will also be considered)
Good understanding of industry best practices and hands-on experience with application security in a software environment (ideally SaaS)
Solid penetration and vulnerability testing knowledge using tools such as Burp Suite, OWASP ZAP, CSRFTester, Metasploit, etc.
Coding experience with at least one of the relevant programming languages (Python is preferred, including but not limited to JavaScript, Java, Scala, C++)
Strong analytical skills with excellent attention to detail as well as ability to make connections across and between different areas
Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments
Ability to work quickly to meet deadlines in a fast-paced company
Professional security certifications an asset
Most importantly, you share our values...
You roll up your sleeves
You make it easy
You are proud
You never stop learning
You play to win
Health & Safety at Visier
Visier is committed to creating a safe and healthy environment for our employees, customers and community. As part of this commitment, we require all employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 or qualify for an exemption.
See the #VisierLife in action
Instagram

The Opportunity

Looking for a new challenge and opportunities to expand your capabilities in the world of energy? If so, Ulteig has an exciting opportunity for you! We are looking for a unique individual who is passionate about Networking and Power Systems.

The Infrastructure & Security Analyst shall serve as a technical lead and shall be responsible for providing planning, design, engineering and consulting of robust secure substation and renewable facility networks. Responsibilities will also include mentoring less experienced engineers and providing business development support.


What You'll Do

Responsible for ongoing security architecture review and development of cyber security controls for Cloud, Network, Endpoint, and Applications.
Monitor industry best practices and trends to support the ongoing development of cyber controls to remediate current and emerging cyber threats.
Develop and implement cyber security solutions for applications, endpoint security, web & email security, cloud security, FW/IPS, SD-WAN NAC controls, and zero trust network architecture.
Experience in Network Security, Cyber Defense, Vulnerability Management, Security Architecture and Cloud Environment

Other tasks include:

Maintains positive client relationships
Independently completes assigned tasks
Actively manages individual workload
Serves as Technical Lead for network and substation specific projects
Effectively assists in training and mentoring team members
Develops and maintains design documents, diagrams, standards, and specifications
Works collaboratively as a team, as well as independently
Proposal development support
Completes all other duties as assigned


What We Expect from You

Bachelor’s degree in Telecommunications Engineering, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or equivalent field of study is preferred (post-graduate diploma in similar field of study with 4+ years of experience can also be considered)
Strong communication skills required
Experience with network integration and troubleshooting field equipment preferred
Networking/IT certifications like Cisco Certified Network Associate a plus for entry-level position (advanced positions prefer CCNP, CISSP, AWS/Azure certifications)
Familiarity with information security standards and frameworks including ISO 27002, NIST, NERC CIP standards, etc
Responsible for ongoing security architecture review and development of cyber security controls for Cloud, Network, Endpoint, and Applications
Monitor industry best practices and trends to support the ongoing development of cyber controls to remediate current and emerging cyber threats
Develop and implement cyber security solutions for applications, endpoint security, web & email security, cloud security, FW/IPS, SD-WAN NAC controls, and zero trust network architecture
Experience in Network Security, Cyber Defense, Vulnerability Management, Security Architecture and Cloud Environment
Familiarity with multiple communication protocols (DNP/Modbus/IEC61850/TCP/UDP) and physical communication mediums (RS232, RS485, copper, fiber, etc.) preferred
Experience with design, implement and maintain all aspects of network environment including routers, Firewalls, switching and wireless. Experience with Cisco products is preferred
Knowledge and experience in the application and management of routing protocol selection, quality of service (QoS) implementation, lab and production test plans, are preferred
Knowledge and experience in network engineering best practices including subnetting, VLAN management, configuration management, authentication, etc.
Experience with Design, implement and maintain all aspects of network environment including routers, Firewalls, switching and wireless. Experience with Cisco products is preferred
Help write/review documentation, policies, and standards governing OT security
Understanding and experience with NERC CIP standards and how the control environment impacts both the business and IT processes, and systems is preferred
Design and perform server and security audits, verify system backup procedures, and other recovery processes in accordance with the company’s disaster recovery and business continuity strategies
Solid understanding of the OSI model
Basic knowledge for configuring or managing physical or virtual servers
PE registration or ability to successfully obtain PE registration is preferred
Experience defining electric utility communication systems needs and implementing solutions in substation environment preferred
Experience coordinating and negotiating with other utilities and companies, regarding communications system interconnections preferred
Previous experience working with a Utility is highly preferred
Knowledge and experience in the application and management of SCADA, RTUs and relays, and electric utility automation networks preferred
Knowledge and experience engineering protection and control systems for substation design, including but not limited to one-lines, three-lines, AC and DC schematics, wiring diagrams, and relay settings at medium to extra-high voltage classifications, is a plus
Experience with the following is a plus: Wireshark, Python, Linux, Cisco CLI, CISCO Packet Tracer, VMware, Visio, pgAdmin, PuTTy
Must have permanent authorization to work in Canada
Must possess a valid Canadian Driver's License


What You Can Expect from Ulteig

Ulteig is a purpose driven organization that has built a culture focused on people – both our clients and our employees for over 75 years. Working at Ulteig is more than a job, it means you will have the opportunity to make a difference by creating and solving for a sustainable future. We realize that a huge part of our success has relied heavily on the dedication and focus of our workforce; this is why we make investing in our employees a top priority. Being 100% employee-owned means, we take our own success and the success of our clients personally.

We offer our team members:

Flexible Workplace
Employee Ownership
Competitive Pay
Comprehensive Benefits Package
Collaborative Environment
Innovative Culture

Our vision is to be the most trusted partners transforming our world’s critical infrastructure. Ulteig connects people and resources to develop compelling, integrated solutions across multiple Lifeline Sectors®, including power, renewables, transportation and water. Ulteig's footprint spans the country and leverages its expertise with a wide range of public and private clients.

At Ulteig, we deeply care and listen to the needs of our team to ensure they are comfortable and have the necessary tools to be productive whether they choose to work remotely, hybrid or in office. We strive to allow a balance and separation between home and work life and provide support and a flexible working schedule so that employees are able to focus on what's important to them. Our offices are currently open, and employees have the option of accessing them to work. We will continue to monitor and respond to COVID-19 proactively to ensure the safety of our valued employees.

If you would like to be a part of a company that empowers their employees, apply today!

Role Summary:

Cyber Experts is seeking a Securty Analyst to join SOC team. Security Analyst Support higher-level security operations by monitoring alerts during critical and high-volume events and by responding to security incidents according to established policies and best practices. Provide guidance to tier I and other first responders for the proper handling of information security incidents. Coordinate efforts of and provide timely updates to multiple business units during response and provide recommendations to the units, as required.

Qualifications Requirement:
Minimum of 3 years of experience with network scurity or related fieldKnowledge of TCP/IP, OSI layer, and common protocols, and how applications work at the network level (DNS, SMTP, HTTP, FTP etc.)Experience of network investigation, event analysis, escalation and reporting proceduresKnowledge of Windows based Server operating system including file system, registry function, permission and privileges settings.Knowledge of network monitoring, analysis, troubleshooting, and configuration control technologiesAbility take traing or learn and operate in a dynamic fast paced environmentExperience with various Anti Virus, Firewall or protection system.BS degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Security, or Information SystemsSecurity related certification such as Security+, CISSP, CEH, CISM or GCIH
Additional Qualifications:
Experience with working in a 24/7 SOC environmentExperience with managing enterprise SIEM products (ArcSight, McAfee, Splunk) or other logging systemsExperience with Incident response, forensic analysis and log file analysisKnowledge of Windows Server OS, Linux/UNIX operating systems and command line toolsExcellent oral and written communication skills Mississauga, ON

Security Analyst, Information Systems


What we’re about


IMAX is not your everyday entertainment experience, so it’s not surprising that IMAX employees and their careers go beyond the ordinary. Our employees share a passion for quality in everything they do. Our Hollywood people are movie business insiders with years of production experience. Our technology experts are unashamedly geeky – people who can talk for hours, and be riveting, about color gamut and lasers. Our business people are consummate sales and marketing professionals who are spreading the IMAX word around the world.


Of course we offer all the benefits you’d expect from a company with over 50 years of history. Yet, beyond this, we know everyone works differently and is motivated by different things. That’s why we offer competitive pay and a wide assortment of benefits – to help you make the most of your life at work and away from it.


As the world’s leading entertainment technology company, IMAX has revolutionized the way people experience movies. Specializing in immersive motion picture technologies, our employees are driven by a passion to take audiences around the world to places they’ve only dreamed of.


Come explore IMAX – where innovation, creativity and passion come together.
Required Skills
What you’ll be doing:


We are seeking a hands-on Information Security Analyst to work in our growing Information Security team. You will monitor our networks for security issues using best-of-breed security tools, identifying and investigating potential security events, and resolving security issues identified as part of your investigation. Another key responsibility of our role is to manage and maintain our theatre firewall infrastructure. To do well in this role you should have a strong background in networking, operating system management, and experience in a security role. Formal training in Information Security or Computer Science is an asset. Having worked with Juniper firewalls in an administrative and maintenance capacity is required.


As a Security Analyst - Theatres with IMAX, you will be responsible to:


Manage and maintain theatre firewall infrastructure; support installation, manage upgrades and operation of the firewalls, and work with theatre partner network support to integrate into their networks;
Monitor networks for security events and issues; Investigate and respond to cyber security incidents
Document security incidents and assess any potential impact to IMAX
Conduct security risk assessments and participate in industry audits
Develop company-wide standards, policies and best practices for IT security
Document procedures for and mitigation techniques to cross-train IT Helpdesk
Work with internal IMAX teams on security, risk, governance and project-based programs
Act as Information Security subject matter expert and provide support to IMAX projects
Support IMAX engineering, theatre installation and theatre support teams as a subject matter expert and Tier 2 support


What we’re looking for:


Strong logical and analytical troubleshooting skills
Experience with enterprise-class IT Infrastructure
Windows, Linux OS
Routing, Switching and Firewall products (Palo Alto, Juniper, Cisco Meraki)
Mobile Device Management
Endpoint Protection technologies
Vulnerability scanning and penetration methodologies
Advanced knowledge of security tools and technologies:
Splunk infrastructure, queries and visualizations
Intrusion Detection capabilities
Palo Alto firewalls and Global Protect
Workstation encryption
2+ years dedicated Information Security experience
3+ years dedicated networking experience
Experience working with Juniper firewalls (SRX300), managing infrastructure, supporting interconnectivity to/within client networks
Excellent communication and inter-personal presentation skills
Strong written and oral communication skills, and the ability to communicate technical information to a non-technical audience
Creative problem-solver
Must be able to manage multiple tasks and prioritize tasks appropriately
Ability to work independently or as part of a team
Provide advanced-level of information security support of IMAX projects
Ability to complete tasks effectively with minimal supervision

Required Experience
Our Commitment to you:


For consideration, please apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest in IMAX but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


At IMAX you'll be part of a culture built on respect - one that recognizes the unique talents of everyone on the team. We're proud of the differences that make us all unique and we support unity, acceptance and equal rights for all. Diversity and inclusion among our employees are critical to our success as a global company.


Before you start with IMAX, all employment is subject to background and reference checks. Additionally, our Canada employees are subject to our mandatory Covid-19 vaccine policy.


IMAX is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Security Analyst, Information Systems

IMAX is not your everyday entertainment experience, so it’s not surprising that IMAX employees and their careers go beyond the ordinary. Our employees share a passion for quality in everything they do. Our Hollywood people are movie business insiders with years of production experience. Our technology experts are unashamedly geeky – people who can talk for hours, and be riveting, about color gamut and lasers. Our business people are consummate sales and marketing professionals who are spreading the IMAX word around the world.


Of course we offer all the benefits you’d expect from a company with over 50 years of history. Yet, beyond this, we know everyone works differently and is motivated by different things. That’s why we offer competitive pay and a wide assortment of benefits – to help you make the most of your life at work and away from it.

job_title: Software Engineer - Security, Cloud, and Monitoring
listing_jobDesc:
Software Engineer - Security, Cloud, and Monitoring
UrbanLogiq offers an integrated data visualization and analytics platform to governments. Founded in 2016, UrbanLogiq is one of the global govtech industry's fastest-growing start-ups and we want you to join our team.
UrbanLogiq exclusively serves public government agencies providing them with cloud-based SaaS solutions that help them better create, manage, use, and consume insights from data, making government services more efficient and effective.
Our mission is to democratize cutting-edge data science and software services for governments of all shapes and sizes paving the way for stronger, safer, better-connected communities. UrbanLogiq's award-winning software is currently used by government agencies across Canada and the US.
What You Will Do
This job builds the glue that holds our platform together. You will be an active contributor to the product, specifically around areas that impact security and identity.
You love metrics. You love data. You want to gather it and graph it and set alerts on it. You think our existing SLOs aren't good enough and want to find another 9.
You want to automate the toil. You want to spend your time working on more high value tasks. But you also know there's a limit where it's not worth it either.
You know your infrastructure. You know how to get the team the cloud resources they need while making sure that we don't bankrupt the company doing so.
You have customer empathy and a passion for helping governments to make data-driven decisions. You will meet directly with clients and internal stakeholders to coordinate SSO and other integrations with client systems.
You are eager to mentor other team members and grow their infrastructure knowledge and skills. You will level-up our entire organization in terms of SRE practices.
Position Requirements
A technical degree (computer science, mathematics, statistics, or physics), or equivalent work experience as a site reliability engineer
Experience developing with statically typed languages like Go or Rust, and scripting languages like Python
Nice to Haves
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure
Hands-on experience with Kubernetes
Hands-on experience with Terraform
Hands-on experience hooking up SSO either with OIDC, SAML, or both.
Demonstrated experience coordinating with end users and other stakeholders on technical implementations.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and an ability to communicate on technical topics with non-technical audiences.
A desire to mentor team members and grow the live service experience and skills of the entire team.


UrbanLogiq is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at UrbanLogiq are based on our business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to age, race, colour, religion or belief, family or parental status, sex, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Software Engineer - Security, Cloud, and Monitoring

companyName: The Corporation of the City of Brantford
listing_jobDesc: The City of Brantford is recruiting temporary contract positions to assist with implementing Development Approvals Streamlining Funding Projects and Initiatives across the Corporation. The Ontario government has announced a new $45-million Streamline Development Approval Fund to help Ontario's large municipalities improve systems for managing and approving housing applications.Reporting to the Manager of IT Infrastructure Service and Support, the Network Engineer's role is to ensure the stability, integrity, efficient and continual operation of the City's wired and wireless networks. This position is responsible for designing, implementing, monitoring, maintaining and optimizing local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), wireless local area networks (WLANs) across the organization. The Network Engineer will also analyze and resolve network hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion, and provide end user training where required.This is an eight (8) month contract position with the possibility of an extension.QUALIFICATIONSA two (2) year College Diploma in System / Network Engineering and Security Analyst or equivalentA minimum of five (5) years of related work experience in a medium to large organizationExpert level understanding of network standards such as OSI Model, IEEE standards and Network Topologies5 years' experience diagnosing and troubleshooting LAN/WAN and Wireless infrastructures5 years' experience implementing, administration and troubleshooting enterprise class network switches, routers, firewalls, Wireless controller and security appliances, i.e. Intrusion Prevention systems. Cisco / Aruba experience an assetExpert Level knowledge designing and implementing LAN, WAN and WLAN infrastructuresProficient knowledge of Network Quality of Service (QOS) supporting network sensitive systems, i.e. VOIP enabled technologiesExpert level knowledge of TCP/IP and services such as HTTP, DNS, DHCP, FTP, SSH, SMTP, SNMP, IPSEC etc.Proficient level knowledge of load balancing technologies for servers, network security appliances etc.Expert level knowledge of standby and failover protocols such as OSPF and Cisco HSRPExpert level knowledge implementing Site-to-Site or Client-to-Site VPN'sExpert level knowledge of network security principles and network management best practicesPrevious knowledge and experience working with server virtualization (VMWARE)Knowledge of UPS setup, administration and monitoringProficient with network capacity planning and diagnostic toolsProficient level knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory and supporting services, i.e. DFS & GPOStrong, hands-on technical knowledge of desktop and server operating systems, including version of MS Windows desktop and server operating systems, Linux versions and Apple Macintosh systemsProficient level knowledge of network monitoring systems, i.e. Solarwinds Orion / Cisco Network AssistantProficient in the creation of system build/change and termination documentation and diagramsAble to conduct research into networking issues and products as requiredTo apply on-line, please visit the City of Brantford website at https://careers.brantford.ca/ and click on Current Opportunities.Information gathered relative to this position will only be used for candidate selection.We thank each applicant for taking the time and effort to submit your resume, however, only candidates to be interviewed will be contacted.Our organization is committed to promoting the independence, dignity, integration, and equality of opportunity of persons with disabilities by ensuring the accessibility of our facilities and services. Accommodations are available for all parts of the recruitment and selection process. Applicants need to make their required accommodations known in advance.Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contractSalary: $41.22-$51.52 per hourApplication deadline: 2022-08-18 The City of Brantford is recruiting temporary contract positions to assist with implementing Development Approvals Streamlining Funding Projects and Initiatives across the Corporation. The Ontario government has announced a new $45-million Streamline Development Approval Fund to help Ontario's large municipalities improve systems for managing and approving housing applications.Reporting to the Manager of IT Infrastructure Service and Support, the Network Engineer's role is to ensure the stability, integrity, efficient and continual operation of the City's wired and wireless networks. This position is responsible for designing, implementing, monitoring, maintaining and optimizing local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), wireless local area networks (WLANs) across the organization. The Network Engineer will also analyze and resolve network hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion, and provide end user training where required.This is an eight (8) month contract position with the possibility of an extension.QUALIFICATIONSA two (2) year College Diploma in System / Network Engineering and Security Analyst or equivalentA minimum of five (5) years of related work experience in a medium to large organizationExpert level understanding of network standards such as OSI Model, IEEE standards and Network Topologies5 years' experience diagnosing and troubleshooting LAN/WAN and Wireless infrastructures5 years' experience implementing, administration and troubleshooting enterprise class network switches, routers, firewalls, Wireless controller and security appliances, i.e. Intrusion Prevention systems. Cisco / Aruba experience an assetExpert Level knowledge designing and implementing LAN, WAN and WLAN infrastructuresProficient knowledge of Network Quality of Service (QOS) supporting network sensitive systems, i.e. VOIP enabled technologiesExpert level knowledge of TCP/IP and services such as HTTP, DNS, DHCP, FTP, SSH, SMTP, SNMP, IPSEC etc.Proficient level knowledge of load balancing technologies for servers, network security appliances etc.Expert level knowledge of standby and failover protocols such as OSPF and Cisco HSRPExpert level knowledge implementing Site-to-Site or Client-to-Site VPN'sExpert level knowledge of network security principles and network management best practicesPrevious knowledge and experience working with server virtualization (VMWARE)Knowledge of UPS setup, administration and monitoringProficient with network capacity planning and diagnostic toolsProficient level knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory and supporting services, i.e. DFS & GPOStrong, hands-on technical knowledge of desktop and server operating systems, including version of MS Windows desktop and server operating systems, Linux versions and Apple Macintosh systemsProficient level knowledge of network monitoring systems, i.e. Solarwinds Orion / Cisco Network AssistantProficient in the creation of system build/change and termination documentation and diagramsAble to conduct research into networking issues and products as requiredTo apply on-line, please visit the City of Brantford website at https://careers.brantford.ca/ and click on Current Opportunities.Information gathered relative to this position will only be used for candidate selection.We thank each applicant for taking the time and effort to submit your resume, however, only candidates to be interviewed will be contacted.Our organization is committed to promoting the independence, dignity, integration, and equality of opportunity of persons with disabilities by ensuring the accessibility of our facilities and services. Description

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.


The IT Operations Center (ITOC) ensures a safe and reliable technology environment for Air Canada with focus on troubleshooting and operational tasks to support our critical IT services: core infrastructure, applications and digital. The ITOC team is constantly engaging with the core IT teams to find ways to proactively monitor the environment and develop skills to handle vital operations and is a key enabler of service automation within the IT portfolio.


This position will be reporting to the Manager, IT & Cyber Operations.


Functional Accountabilities

Act as an escalation point for service desk and other Air Canada IT teams as they identify issues regarding our technology environment

Effectively escalate service impacting issues to the correct teams and collaborate to ensure the issue is resolved as soon as possible. Preliminary troubleshooting before escalating is required. Proactively respond to alerts by performing correctional tasks to remediate issues and prevent larger issues from occurring

In the event of a major incident act as coordinator for the on-duty Major Incident owner including organizing communications and tracking troubleshooting actions

Provide daily support for the extended IT support teams by performing documented operational procedures that will optimize the systems environment

Ensure monitoring tools are tweaked and configured properly to effectively receive proactive alerts

Work closely with the IT service management team to identify reoccurring problems within the technical systems and work towards resolution and/or documented procedures to mitigate

Work with ITOC BA's, automation analysts and the extended IT team to expand the ITOC portfolio of services through documenting design, standard operating procedures and other opportunities to provide value.

Make recommendations for Service Improvement Plans and ensure actions are followed through to completion in a timely manner

Work with internal and third-party teams to ensure actions are taken and completed to protect and improve services

Provide assistance to cyber defence teams regarding IT certificate management.

Conduct investigations and make proactive decisions in cloud web portals according to IT security procedures.

Develop knowledge of monitoring tools that will be used to monitor Air Canada's IT infrastructure.

Collaborate with the IT operations team to investigate and mitigate repetitive incidents in the IT service.
Qualifications

A relevant University degree/technical certification, and/or relevant experience commensurate to the role

3-5 years' experience in an enterprise IT environment or global NOC.

At least 5+ years of experience in the following: IT Monitoring tools such as Dynatrace, Splunk , Glassbox etc. IT iMajor Incidents, ITIL process concepts and execution (Incident Management, Problem Management, and Change Management), ITSM tools and processes, and in an operational technical role under application, infrastructure or network operations support or as a senior team member in a related service

Recent Certifications in a related domain such as CCNA, MSCE, AWS, CSP, ITIL,etc.

Ability to work effectively under pressure and in rapidly changing environments or uncertain conditions

Ability to work cooperatively with others on a team and to communicate (verbally and in writing) effectively with all levels of the organization

Demonstrates concern for satisfying one's external and/or internal customers

Anticipates the implications and consequences of situations and takes appropriate action to be prepared for possible contingencies

Excellent organizational and troubleshooting skills and a passion for Service Improvement

Assets: DevOps, Web and Mobile apps support; Security+ or other security certifications; Linux certifications or experience; Storage knowledge and troubleshooting; CCNA or equivalent networking experience; Certification in ITIL; SolarWinds, Dynatrace, NetScout certification or extensive experience

This position requires a high level of availability and flexibility as shift work is a requirement as this role. Shift-work might include nights, weekends, statutory holidays and on-call schedule when needed.

Conditions of Employment:

Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.

Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.


Diversity and Inclusion


Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees' unique contributions to our company's success.


As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted Description

Ability to work effectively under pressure and in rapidly changing environments or uncertain conditions

Demonstrates concern for satisfying one's external and/or internal customers

Anticipates the implications and consequences of situations and takes appropriate action to be prepared for possible contingencies

Excellent organizational and troubleshooting skills and a passion for Service Improvement

Assets: DevOps, Web and Mobile apps support; Security+ or other security certifications; Linux certifications or experience; Storage knowledge and troubleshooting; CCNA or equivalent networking experience; Certification in ITIL; SolarWinds, Dynatrace, NetScout certification or extensive experience

This position requires a high level of availability and flexibility as shift work is a requirement as this role. Shift-work might include nights, weekends, statutory holidays and on-call schedule when needed.

Conditions of Employment:

Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.

Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.


Diversity and Inclusion


Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees' unique contributions to our company's success.


As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted Description

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.


The IT Operations Center (ITOC) ensures a safe and reliable technology environment for Air Canada with focus on troubleshooting and operational tasks to support our critical IT services: core infrastructure, applications and digital. The ITOC team is constantly engaging with the core IT teams to find ways to proactively monitor the environment and develop skills to handle vital operations and is a key enabler of service automation within the IT portfolio.


This position will be reporting to the Manager, IT & Cyber Operations.


Functional Accountabilities

Act as an escalation point for service desk and other Air Canada IT teams as they identify issues regarding our technology environment

Effectively escalate service impacting issues to the correct teams and collaborate to ensure the issue is resolved as soon as possible. Preliminary troubleshooting before escalating is required. Proactively respond to alerts by performing correctional tasks to remediate issues and prevent larger issues from occurring

In the event of a major incident act as coordinator for the on-duty Major Incident owner including organizing communications and tracking troubleshooting actions

Provide daily support for the extended IT support teams by performing documented operational procedures that will optimize the systems environment

Ensure monitoring tools are tweaked and configured properly to effectively receive proactive alerts

Work closely with the IT service management team to identify reoccurring problems within the technical systems and work towards resolution and/or documented procedures to mitigate

Work with ITOC BA's, automation analysts and the extended IT team to expand the ITOC portfolio of services through documenting design, standard operating procedures and other opportunities to provide value.

Make recommendations for Service Improvement Plans and ensure actions are followed through to completion in a timely manner

Work with internal and third-party teams to ensure actions are taken and completed to protect and improve services

Provide assistance to cyber defence teams regarding IT certificate management.

Conduct investigations and make proactive decisions in cloud web portals according to IT security procedures.

Develop knowledge of monitoring tools that will be used to monitor Air Canada's IT infrastructure.

Collaborate with the IT operations team to investigate and mitigate repetitive incidents in the IT service.
Qualifications

A relevant University degree/technical certification, and/or relevant experience commensurate to the role

3-5 years' experience in an enterprise IT environment or global NOC.

At least 5+ years of experience in the following: IT Monitoring tools such as Dynatrace, Splunk , Glassbox etc. IT iMajor Incidents, ITIL process concepts and execution (Incident Management, Problem Management, and Change Management), ITSM tools and processes, and in an operational technical role under application, infrastructure or network operations support or as a senior team member in a related service

Recent Certifications in a related domain such as CCNA, MSCE, AWS, CSP, ITIL,etc.

Ability to work effectively under pressure and in rapidly changing environments or uncertain conditions

Ability to work cooperatively with others on a team and to communicate (verbally and in writing) effectively with all levels of the organization

Demonstrates concern for satisfying one's external and/or internal customers

Anticipates the implications and consequences of situations and takes appropriate action to be prepared for possible contingencies

Excellent organizational and troubleshooting skills and a passion for Service Improvement

Assets: DevOps, Web and Mobile apps support; Security+ or other security certifications; Linux certifications or experience; Storage knowledge and troubleshooting; CCNA or equivalent networking experience; Certification in ITIL; SolarWinds, Dynatrace, NetScout certification or extensive experience

This position requires a high level of availability and flexibility as shift work is a requirement as this role. Shift-work might include nights, weekends, statutory holidays and on-call schedule when needed.

Conditions of Employment:

Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.

Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.
